 (i) the liquid level of each storage tank shall be measured,
 (ii) a record of such measurements shall be retained for inspection, and
 (iii) all fill pipe covers and covers over openings for measuring liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be locked, and
 (b) prior to the start of an operating season,
 (i) the liquid level in each storage tank shall be measured,
 (ii) the measurements shall be compared with those recorded at the close of the previous season, and
 (iii) when a loss of liquid or water intrusion is apparent, immediate action shall be taken to determine and correct the condition.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank has been out of service for more than 12 months, the tank and piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves that are necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.
P/T Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank referred to in Sentence 4.3.16.2.(1) contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and compared with subsequent readings taken at intervals not greater than one month.
P/T Sentence Text: When a storage tank referred to in Sentence (1) contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and the readings compared at intervals not greater than one month.

National Sentence Text: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping, and the storage tank markings shall clearly indicate that the tank is empty.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.

National Sentence Text: Every outside aboveground storage tank for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in conformance with Sentences 4.3.2.1.(2) to 4.3.2.1.(5) with respect to a property line or a building on the same property.
P/T Sentence Text: Every outside aboveground storage tank for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located in conformance with Sentences (2) to (5) with respect to the property line and any building on the same property.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.3.2.1.(6) and 4.3.2.1.(7), every aboveground storage tank containing stable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances half those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection referred to in Sentence 4.3.2.1.(2) is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentences (6) and (7), every aboveground storage tank containing stable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from a property line and any building on the same property by distances

(a) half those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or

(b) equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection referred to in Clause (a) is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Every aboveground storage tank containing unstable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 7.5 m, where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or 3 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 15 m, where protection referred to in Sentence 4.3.2.1.(3) is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text:
Every aboveground storage tank containing unstable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from a property line and any building on the same property by distances

(a) equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A., but not less than 7.5 m, where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or

(b) three times those in Table 4.3.2.A., but not less than 15 m, where protection referred to in Clause (a) is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Every aboveground storage tank containing boil-over liquids shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances 0.75 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection referred to in Sentence 4.3.2.1.(4) is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text:
Every aboveground storage tank containing boil-over liquids shall be separated from a property line and any building on the same property by distances

(a) 0.75 times those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or

(b) equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A. where protection referred to in Clause (a) is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line or a building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences 4.3.2.1.(2) and 4.3.2.1.(3) multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line and any building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences (2) and (3) multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1.(2) from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to 1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 50?000 L, or zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2?500 L.
P/T Sentence Text:
The minimum distance required in Sentence (2) from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to

(a) 1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 50000 L, or

(b) zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2500 L.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1.(2) is permitted to be waived provided the storage tank is in conformance with ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text:
The minimum distance required in Sentence (2) is permitted to be waived provided the storage tank

(a) is in conformance with ULC-S655, “Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids”, and

(b) has a capacity of not more than 50000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 4.3.2.2.(2) and 4.3.2.2.(3) and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of 2 aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences (2) and (3) and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of two aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance between any 2 storage tanks, neither of which has a capacity of more than 250?000 L, shall be 1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance between any two storage tanks, neither of which has a capacity of more than 250000 L, shall be 1 m.

National Sentence Text: Where either of 2 aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences 4.3.2.2.(1) and 4.3.2.2.(2) shall be doubled.
P/T Sentence Text: Where either of the two aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be doubled.

National Article Title: Clearances from Liquefied Petroleum Gas Cylinders and Tanks
National Sentence Text: Secondary containments for flammable liquid and combustible liquid storage tanks shall not contain any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or tank, and the centre line of the secondary containment wall shall be not less than 3 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas cylinder, and 6 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas tank.
P/T Article Title: Clearances from liquefied petroleum gas cylinders and tanks
P/T Sentence Text:
Secondary containments for flammable liquid or combustible liquid storage tanks shall not contain any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or tank, and the centre line of the secondary containment wall shall be not less than

(a) 3 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas cylinder, and

(b) 7 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas storage tank.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.3.2.4.(2) and 4.3.2.4.(3), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for firefighting purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for fire fighting purposes.

National Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.
P/T Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any storage tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fires or explosions in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fire or explosion in conformance with Sentence (2).

National Sentence Text: Protection against fires or explosions required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 11-2016 Low-, Medium-, and High-Expansion Foam NFPA 15-2012 Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection and NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text:
Protection against fire or explosion required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as described in

(a) NFPA 11, “Standard for Low?, Medium?, and High?Expansion Foam”,

(b) NFPA 15, “Standard for Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection”, and

(c) NFPA 69, “Standard on Explosion Prevention Systems”.

National Sentence Text: Where the clearance below the base of the tank exceeds 300 mm, tank supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: If the clearance below the base of a storage tank exceeds 300 mm, the supports for the storage tank shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with Part 4 of Division B of the NBC, and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text:
In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with

(a) Part 4 in Division B of the Building Code, and

(b) Appendix A2 of CAN/ULC-S601, “Standard for Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids”.

National Sentence Text: When aboveground storage tanks are located in an area that is subject to flooding, the tanks shall be securely anchored to prevent floating.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground storage tanks located in an area that may be subject to flooding shall be securely anchored.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Atmospheric and low pressure storage tanks shall be provided with normal and emergency venting in conformance with API 2000-2009 Venting Atmospheric and Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or the tank design standards listed in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text:
Atmospheric and low pressure storage tanks shall be provided with normal and emergency venting in conformance with

(a) API 2000, “Venting Atmospheric and Low-Pressure Storage Tanks”, or

(b) the appropriate tank design standard set out in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).

National Sentence Text: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be allowed for in the determination of the total venting capacity.
P/T Sentence Text: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be included in the determination of the total venting capacity.

National Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class I liquids shall be located outside buildings not less than 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, and 1.5 m from any building opening, and shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter the building or be trapped near any part of the building.
P/T Sentence Text:
Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class I liquids

(a) shall be located outside buildings, not less than

(i) 3.5 m above the adjacent ground level, and

(ii) 1.5 m from any building opening, and

(b) shall discharge so that flammable vapours will not enter the building or be trapped near any part of the building.

National Sentence Text: Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class II or IIIA liquids shall discharge outside buildings not less than 2 m above the adjacent ground level, and 1.5 m from any building opening.
P/T Sentence Text:
Normal vent pipe outlets for storage tanks of Class II or IIIA liquids shall discharge outside buildings, not less than

(a) 2 m above the adjacent ground level, and

(b) 1.5 m from any building opening.

National Sentence Text: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of any building's exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of a building exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.5.3.(2), 2 or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), two or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping for storage tanks forClass I liquids shall not be connected to vent piping for storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids unless an effective arrangement is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquids from entering the other tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Vent piping for storage tanks for Class I liquids shall not be connected to vent piping for storage tanks for Class II or IIIA liquids unless an effective arrangement is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquids from entering the other tanks.

National Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which the liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.

National Sentence Text: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank that is below the liquid level and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Each connection that is located below the liquid level of the aboveground storage tank and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.

National Sentence Text: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel are permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel shall be used.

National Sentence Text: Openings for measuring liquid levels in storage tanks forClass I liquids shall be equipped with caps or covers which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for measuring liquid levels in storage tanks for Class I liquids shall be equipped with caps or covers which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.6.4.(3), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.
P/T Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (3), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying storage tanks for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be located

(a) outside buildings,

(b) at a location free of sources of ignition, and

(c) not less than 1.5 m from building openings.

National Sentence Text: A filling connection described in Sentence 4.3.6.4.(1) is permitted to be located inside a building if this is made necessary by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or for the collection of used liquids, and the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.
P/T Sentence Text:
A filling connection described in Sentence (1) is permitted to be located inside a building where

(a) made necessary

(i) by a process or activity located indoors and to which the tank is directly associated, or

(ii) for the collection of used liquids, and

(b) the fill piping is provided with means to prevent flammable vapours from returning to the building.

National Sentence Text: A storage tank conforming to Sentence 4.3.7.4.(2) shall be considered as conforming to this Subsection provided it is used and maintained in conformance with Articles 4.3.7.8. and 4.3.7.9.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank conforming to Sentence 4.3.7.4.(2) shall be considered as conforming to this Subsection provided it is used and maintained in conformance with Articles 4.3.7.8. and 4.3.7.9.

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (2), the base and walls of a secondary containment shall be made of noncombustible materials, and shall be designed, constructed and maintained to
a) withstand full hydrostatic head, and
b) provideapermeabilityofnotmorethan10-6 cm/stothe flammable liquids or combustible liquids contained in the storage tanks.
P/T Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence (2), the base and walls of a secondary containment shall be made of noncombustible materials, and shall be designed, constructed and maintained to

(a) withstand full hydrostatic head, and

(b) provide a permeability of not more than 10-6 cm/s to the flammable liquids or combustible liquids contained in the storage tanks.

National Sentence Text: A membrane providing the level of impermeability required in Sentence 4.3.7.2.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S668-12 Liners Used for Secondary Containment of Aboveground Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tanks and if it is combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material that will prevent the membrane from failing in the event that the secondary containment is exposed to fire.
P/T Sentence Text:
Where a membrane provides the level of impermeability required in Sentence (1), the membrane shall

(a) conform to ULC/ORD-C58.9, “Secondary Containment Liners for Underground and Aboveground Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tanks”, and

(b) if combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material of such nature and thickness that the membrane will not fail when the secondary containment is exposed to fire.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.7.2.(4), openings shall not be permitted in a secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (4), there shall be no openings in a secondary containment.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.7.3.(3), a secondary containment for more than one storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the sum of the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space, and 10% of the greater of the capacity specified in Sentence 4.3.7.3.(2), or the aggregate capacity of all other storage tanks located in the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text:
Except as permitted in Sentence (3), a secondary containment for more than one storage tank shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the sum of
(a) the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space, and
(b) 10% of the greater of
(i) the capacity specified in Clause (a), or
(ii) the aggregate capacity of all other storage tanks located in the contained space.

National Sentence Text: When the secondary containment is designed to prevent the entry of precipitation and water used for firefighting purposes into the contained space, it shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text: When the secondary containment is designed to prevent the entry of precipitation and water used for fire fighting purposes into the contained space, it shall have a volumetric capacity of not less than the capacity of the largest storage tank located in the contained space.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2),no part of a secondary containment wall shal lbe less than 1.5m from a storage tank shell.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), no part of a secondary containment wall shall be less than 1.5 m from a storage tank shell.

National Sentence Text: The distance required in Sentence 4.3.7.4.(1) is permitted to be waived, provided the storage tank has a capacity of not more than 80 000 L and is constructed in accordance with Clauses 4.3.1.2.(1) , 4.3.1.2.(1) or 4.3.1.2.(1), incorporating secondary containment, or Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1) for double-walled storage tanks, or conforms to ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text:
It is permitted to waive the distance required in Sentence (1) provided the storage tank

(a) is constructed in accordance with

(i) Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(j), (k), (l) or (m), incorporating secondary containment, or

(ii) Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(e) for double-walled storage tanks,

(b) has a capacity of not more than 50000 L, and

(c) is protected by posts or guardrails when exposed to collision damage.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
National Sentence Text: A secondary containment shall permit access to storage tanks, valves and ancillary equipment, egress from the contained space, and access for firefighting as specified in Article 4.3.2.4.
P/T Article Title: Access to storage tanks and ancillary equipment
P/T Sentence Text:
A secondary containment shall be constructed so that it does not interfere with

(a) access to storage tanks, valves and ancillary equipment,

(b) egress from the contained space, and

(c) access for fire fighting as specified in Article 4.3.2.4.

National Article Title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provisions shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall.
P/T Article Title: Access to storage tanks and ancillary equipment
P/T Sentence Text:
Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provision shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when

(a) the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or

(b) the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall.

National Sentence Text: Where the contained space created by the secondary containment is not accessible for an internal visual examination, and the secondary containment is not sloped so as to permit liquid to flow to a specific location that can be monitored, a monitoring device shall be provided to indicate the loss of integrity of the secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text:
The secondary containment shall be equipped with a monitoring device that activates a visual or audible alarm in an attended area in the event of a loss of integrity of the secondary containment unless

(a) the contained space created by the secondary containment is accessible for an internal visual examination, and

(b) the secondary containment is sloped so that liquid would flow to a specific location that can be monitored.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not accumulate in the contained space created by the secondary containment.
P/T Sentence Text: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not be accumulated in the contained space created by the secondary containment.

National Sentence Text: Provisions shall be made for removing liquid from the secondary containment in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Provisions shall be made for removing liquid from the secondary containment in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text:
Controls for the liquid removal system required in Sentence (2)shall be
a) normally closed,
b) accessible under fire exposure conditions, and
c) located so they can be operated from outside the contained space.
P/T Sentence Text:
Controls for the liquid removal system required in Sentence (2) shall be

(a) normally closed,

(b) accessible under fire exposure conditions, and

(c) located so they can be operated from outside the contained space.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks installed underground shall be of double-walled construction and shall be built in conformance with the underground storage tank standards identified in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (2), underground storage tanks shall be double-walled and shall be built in accordance with the underground storage tank standards in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be located so that loads from building foundations and supports are not transmitted to the tank.
P/T Sentence Text:
Underground storage tanks shall be located so that

(a) the foundations of buildings will not be undermined during excavation, and

(b) loads from building foundations and supports are not transmitted to the tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm from adjacent underground tanks or structures, 1 m from a building foundation or a street line, and 1.5 m from other property lines.
P/T Sentence Text:
Underground storage tanks shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than

(a) 600 mm from adjacent underground tanks or structures,

(b) 1 m from a building foundation or a street line, and

(c) 1.5 m from other property lines.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences (2)to (4),underground storage tanks shall be installed with not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentences (2) to (4), underground storage tanks shall be installed with not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the tank.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.8.3.(3), storage tanks subjected to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (3), underground storage tanks subject to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.

National Sentence Text: Where subsurface conditions make it impracticable to install a storage tank totally below adjacent ground level, an underground storage tank shall be installed so that at least 75% of its mass is below adjacent ground level provided there is not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level, or 50% of its mass is below adjacent ground level provided there is not less than 1 m of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text:
If it is not practical to install an underground storage tank completely below adjacent ground level due to subsurface conditions, an underground storage tank shall be built so that at least

(a) 75% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 600 mm of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level, or

(b) 50% of its mass is below adjacent ground level, provided there is not less than 1 m of ground cover over the portion of the tank above adjacent ground level.

National Sentence Text: Damage to storage tank shells shall not be repaired on site.
P/T Sentence Text: Damage to underground storage tank shells shall not be repaired on site.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be lowered into the excavation by the use of lifting lugs and hooks and, where necessary, spreader bars to prevent damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be lowered into the excavation by the use of lifting lugs and hooks and, where necessary, spreader bars to prevent damage to the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.

National Sentence Text: Any method of handling that might result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Any method of handling that may result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.

National Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Underground steel storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix B of CAN/ULC-S603.1, "External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC-S615, "Standard for Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Either a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand is permitted in lieu of the protection described in Sentence 4.3.8.3.(2) provided the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the storage tank.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground storage tank subject to vehicular traffic may be installed under a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand if the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the underground storage tank.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to evenly distribute the weight of the tank on the supporting base.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to distribute evenly the weight of the tank on the supporting base.

National Sentence Text: If a spillage occurs, the escaped liquid and all soil contaminated by the spill shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: If a spillage occurs involving an underground storage tank, the escaped liquid and all soil contaminated by the spill shall be removed in accordance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause the uplift of the tanks once they are empty. (See Note A-4.3.8.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause uplift of the tanks when they are empty.

National Sentence Text: Where anchors and ground straps are used to resist the uplift forces referred to in Sentence 4.3.8.9.(1), they shall be electrically isolated from the tank, and installed in such a manner that they do not damage the tank's shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.
P/T Sentence Text:
Where anchors and ground straps are used to resist the uplift forces referred to in Sentence (1), they shall be

(a) electrically isolated from the tank, and

(b) installed in such a manner that they do not damage the tank shell, protective coating, fittings or anodes.

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
P/T Sentence Text: Every storage tank shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Sentences (2) to (4) whenever a leak is suspected, and at the time of installation before backfilling in the case of an underground tank, or before filling or putting into service in the case of an aboveground tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
P/T Sentence Text:
Piping systems including those at fuel dispensing stations shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Sentences (2) and (3)
 (a) whenever a leak is suspected, and
 (b) at the time of installation
 (i) before backfilling in the case of underground piping, or
 (ii) before putting into service in the case of exposed piping.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text:
Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.1.3.(2), when a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a storage tank, piping system or sump, the leaking components or system shall be repaired and tested, replaced, or removed.

When a leak detection test required by this Section detects a leak in a single-walled construction underground storage tank or piping system, the leaking components or system shall be replaced in conformance with Articles 4.3.8.1. and 4.5.6.1., or taken out of service in conformance with part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: When a leak is detected in a storage tank by a leakage test required in this Subsection or by a leakage detection measure required in Subsection 4.3.16., the storage tank shall be replaced, in the case of an underground tank, or be repaired or replaced in the case of an aboveground tank, and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a leak is detected as described in Sentence 4.4.1.3.(1) or 4.4.1.3.(2), the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: If a leak is detected in a piping system during the leakage test, the piping system shall be repaired or replaced and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring Methods
National Sentence Text: A continuous in-tank leak detection system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The measurements described in Article 4.3.16.1. are not required for an underground storage tank when it is provided with a continuous leakage detection device conforming to ULC/ORD-C58.12, “Leak Detection Devices (Volumetric Type) for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks”, or ULC/ORD-C58.14, “Nonvolumetric Leak Detection Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks”, and its associated underground piping is provided with continuous leakage detection conforming to Article 4.4.6.7.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where field test methods are included in the storage tank construction standards referred to in Articles 4.3.1.2. and 4.3.1.3., such tests shall be permitted for storage tanks conforming to those standards.
P/T Sentence Text: Where field test methods are included in the tank construction standards referred to in Articles 4.3.1.2. and 4.3.1.3., such tests shall be permitted for storage tanks conforming to those standards.

National Sentence Text: During a leak detection test on a storage tank, the pressure at the bottom of the tank shall not exceed the tank manufacturer's specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: The pressure at the bottom of a storage tank shall not exceed 70 kPa (gauge) during the leakage test referred to in Sentence (1).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air shall not be performed on storage tanks and piping systems having once contained flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on storage tanks with flammable liquids or combustible liquids in the tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.3.2.(1), pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air or an inert gas shall include the application of soap and water to the storage tank and piping surface, fittings, joints and connections to help in the detection of leaks.
P/T Sentence Text: When exposed piping systems are subjected to a pneumatic leakage test, it shall be in conformance with Article 4.4.6.4., and the piping, including the joints, shall be soaped to assist in the detection of leaks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: If a pneumatic leakage test is conducted before an underground tank is backfilled in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall comply with the production testing requirements of ULC-S603, "Standard for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids", or ULC-S615, "Standard for Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leakage test is performed on a completely buried storage tank, the test pressure shall be not less than 35 and not more than 70 kPa (gauge).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pneumatic leak detection tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.

National Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leak detection testing in areas where explosive mixtures of flammable liquid or combustible liquid vapours and air may be present in the vicinity of a storage tank that has been in use.
P/T Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leakage testing where explosive mixtures of vapours from flammable liquids or combustible liquids and air may be present in the area of a tank that has been in use.

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Test pressures shall be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leakage test is performed on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure has been removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.4.6.1.(3) shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop or a volume loss within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure had been removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.4.3.4.(6) and 4.4.3.4.(7), test pressure shall be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be permitted unless the piping system is designed for such pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be used except when the piping system is designed for such pressures.

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components connected to the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the test procedure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components included in the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the remainder of the system.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing piping systems, except that pressure piping normally containing Class I liquids is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.
P/T Article Title: Class I liquids as a test medium
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing of piping systems, except that piping normally containing Class I liquids under pressure is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.

National Sentence Text: Where inventory reconciliation is required by this Section, the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days in conformance with Sentences 4.4.4.1.(2) to 4.4.4.1.(4), except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.3.16.2., the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days in conformance with Sentences (2) to (4), except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

National Sentence Text: The level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than 7 days, except that at fuel-dispensing stations the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
P/T Sentence Text: The level of water at the bottom of an underground storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days, except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurement shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

National Sentence Text: Investigative action shall be undertaken if the inventory reconciliation described in Sentence 4.4.2.1.(2) indicates the following inexplicable conditions: a monthly loss of 0.5 percent or more of the throughput from an underground storage tank, or 1.0 percent or more of the throughput from an aboveground storage tank, three consecutive losses greater than 200 L/day, and a water level greater than 50 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: A comparison of the measurements described in Sentences (1) and (2) with meter readings and a computation of any gain or loss of liquid shall be done each time a required measurement is taken.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A record of the measurements for each storage tank and of the computations described in Sentence 4.4.4.1.(3) shall be retained, in conformance with Article 2.2.1.2..
P/T Sentence Text: A record for each storage tank showing the measurements and computations described in Sentence (3) shall be retained for examination by the Chief Fire Official, in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where continuous leak detection is provided on an underground piping system, it shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping
P/T Sentence Text: When an underground piping system is provided with continuous leakage detection, it shall be in conformance with ULC/ORD-C107.12, "Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping".

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel-dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping that falls within the scope of the applicable provincial or territorial codes regulating boilers and pressure vessels.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping within the scope of the applicable provincial boiler and pressure vessel codes.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Standard procedures for normal operation and for emergencies shall be given in printed form to all employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids and shall be posted for convenient reference.
P/T Sentence Text: Standard procedures for normal operations and for emergencies shall be given in printed form to all employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids and combustible liquids and shall be posted or readily available for convenient reference.

National Sentence Text: All employees concerned with transfer operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the procedures referred to in Article 4.5.10.1., the importance of constant attendance during all loading or unloading operations, extinguishing procedures for fires involving flammable liquids and combustible liquids, and the flammable liquid and combustible liquid colour coding and identification system required in Article 4.5.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: All employees participating in transfer operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the procedures referred to in Article 4.4.11.1., the importance of constant attendance during all loading or unloading operations, extinguishing procedures for fires involving flammable liquids and combustible liquids, and the flammable liquids and combustible liquid colour-coding and identification system required in Article 4.4.8.6.

National Sentence Text: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.

National Sentence Text: Signs indicating the location of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves shall be posted in conspicuous locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Signs indicating the location of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves shall be posted in conspicuous locations.

National Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80-B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.
P/T Sentence Text: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.

National Sentence Text: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practicable.
P/T Sentence Text: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any such leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practical.

National Sentence Text: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.

National Sentence Text: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence 4.5.10.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence (2).

National Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link-operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.
P/T Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.10.7.(6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.

National Sentence Text: The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.5.10.7.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be performed in accordance with good engineering practice.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Materials for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made of materials that are suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(3), the use of the following materials for piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(1) shall not be permitted: materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or combustible or low-melting-point materials that are subject to failure even in moderate fires.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (3), piping systems shall not be made of materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or are subject to failure in fires because they are combustible or have a low melting point.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Non-metallic piping systems may be used for underground installations if they comply with CAN/ULC-S660, "Standard for Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(6), where steel piping is used, it shall conform to API 5L-2012 Line Pipe ASTM A 53/A 53M-12 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless or CSA Z245.1-14 Steel Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: If steel piping is used, it shall comply with API 5L, "Line Pipe", ASTM A53/A53M, "Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless", or CSA Z245.1, "Steel Pipe".

National Sentence Text: Where service pressures exceeding 875 kPa (gauge) may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in conformance with ASME B31.3-2016 Process Piping
P/T Sentence Text: If service pressures exceeding 875 kPa (gauge) may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in accordance with ASME B31.3, "Process Piping".

National Sentence Text: Where problems of corrosion, contamination, or sanitation or standards of purity require special materials, it is permitted to use non-metallic materials for piping, valves and fittings in conformance with Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where problems of corrosion, contamination or sanitation or standards of purity require special materials, it is permitted to use non-metallic materials for piping, valves and fittings in conformance with Article 4.1.1.4.

National Sentence Text:
1) Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with

a) CAN/ULC-S603.1, “External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids,”or

b) NACE SP0169, “Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems.”
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), all exposed or underground piping, valves, couplings, flanges and bolts that are fabricated of any ferrous substance shall be thoroughly coated with a rust-resistant compatible material.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or NACE SP0169-2013 Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in accordance with CAN/ULC-S603.1, "External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids", or NACE SP0169, "Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems".

National Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CPPI, "Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification", or to CAN/CGSB-24.3, "Identification of Piping Systems".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Documentation on the piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including the tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.
P/T Sentence Text: Documentation on piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.

National Sentence Text: Documents referred to in Sentence 4.5.4.2.(1) shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Documents referred to in Sentence (1) shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.

National Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-16 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to CAN/ULC-S642, "Standard for Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints".

National Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to part 5. and to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to API 1104-2013 Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall comply with Section 5.17 and API 1104, "Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities", or API RP 1107, "Recommended Pipeline Maintenance Welding Practices".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Flanged joints for piping shall be provided in welded systems at intervals that will facilitate dismantling and avoid subsequent in-place cutting and welding operations.
P/T Sentence Text: Flanged joints for piping shall be provided in welded systems at intervals that will facilitate dismantling and avoid subsequent in place hot work operations.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in accordance with ASME B16.5, "Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings NPS ½ "Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard".

National Sentence Text: Bronze flanges for 50 mm diameter or smaller size piping referred to in Article 4.5.5.2. are permitted to be used where copper and brass piping is permitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Bronze flanges for 50 mm diameter or smaller size piping referred to in Article 4.4.5.2. are permitted to be used where copper and brass piping is permitted.

National Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-16 Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.
P/T Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to "ASTM A193/A193M, "Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications", Grade B-7.

National Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650°C without damage that would impair their function.
P/T Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650" without damage that would impair its function.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical connections in underground piping systems shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, not be in direct contact with the soil, and be provided within a transition sump.
P/T Sentence Text: Where underground piping systems have no secondary containment, mechanical connections shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, and not be in direct contact with the soil.

National Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply to vent risers and vertical fill piping systems.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system conforming to Subsection 4.1.6. shall be provided.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10.(1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence (1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10.(1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Where Class I liquids are handled or used above grade within existing buildings that have basements or covered pits into which flammable vapours can travel and accumulate, such below grade areas shall be provided with mechanical ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Where practicable, overhead piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11.(1) shall be supported from building framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where practical, overhead piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported from building framing members.

National Sentence Text: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11.(1) shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.

National Sentence Text: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded. (See Note A-4.5.6.12.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.

National Sentence Text: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.
P/T Sentence Text: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.

National Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S633-99 Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C536-1998 Flexible Metallic Hose are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to CAN/ULC-S633, “Standard for Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids” are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to CAN/ULC-S660, “Standard for Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids”, are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC/ORD-C536, “Flexible Metallic Hose”, are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.

National Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.

National Sentence Text: It is not permitted to use any portion of a piping system in a manner that could damage it or for any purpose other than the transfer of product.
P/T Sentence Text: No portion of a piping system shall be used in a manner that could cause damage to the piping system.

National Sentence Text: Where vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.
P/T Sentence Text: When vehicular impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for piping referred to in Sentence (1) and for fill pipes for storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.

National Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows and doors.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Piping passing though the secondary containment walls of an aboveground storage tank shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping passing through secondary containment walls shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
