P/T Sentence Text: The maximum number of occupants permitted in any room shall be calculated except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.3.(2), in Group A assembly occupancies, on the basis of the net floor space per occupant specified in Table 2.7.1.3., for occupancies in another group, on the basis of the net floor space per occupant of 0.4 m2, excluding the floor space occupied by furniture and equipment, or on the basis of the number of occupants for which means of egress are provided, if that number is below the number determined under Clause 2.7.1.3.(1)(a)or 2.7.1.3.(1)(b). (See Note A-2.7.1.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The number of occupants permitted to enter a room shall not exceed the maximum occupant load calculated in conformance with Sentence 2.7.1.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The number of occupants admitted to a room shall not exceed the maximum number of occupants calculated in conformance with Sentences 2.7.1.3.(1)to 2.7.1.3.(3).

National Sentence Text: Signs required by the NBC to indicate the occupant load for a floor area shall be posted in conspicuous locations near the principal entrances to the floor area. (See Note A-2.7.1.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Signs required by the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration to indicate the occupant load for a floor area shall be posted in conspicuous locations near the principal entrances to the floor area. (See Note A-2.7.1.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1?100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(4), when nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1?100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the number of seats in the room exceeds 100, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.

National Sentence Text: When nonfixed seats are provided at tables arranged in rows, the spacing between the nearest edges of tables in 2 successive rows shall be not less than 1?400 mm where seating is arranged on both sides of tables (back to back), or 1000 mm where seating is on one side only.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(5), when nonfixed seats are provided at tables arranged in rows, the spacing between the nearest edges of tables in 2 successive rows shall be not less than 1?400 mm where seating is arranged on both sides of tables (back to back), or 1000 mm where seating is on one side only.

Nonfixed seats may be laid out using the criteria in Sections 13.2.5.5 and 13.2.5.6 of NFPA 101-2009 Life Safety Code, if the minimum clear width specified in Clause 2.7.1.5.(1)(a) is respected; and the requirements of Clause 2.7.1.5.(1)(f) are respected.
Tables provided with nonfixed seats may be laid out using the criteria in Sections 13.2.5.7 and 13.2.5.8 of NFPA 101-2009 Life Safety Code

National Sentence Text: Where equipment is provided to melt snow or ice on exterior passageways and exterior exit stairs serving an occupied building, such equipment shall be maintained in working order or alternative measures shall be taken to comply with Sentence 2.7.1.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The windows of sleeping rooms that are required as an exit and are located in a basement shall not be obstructed by snow, materials or objects that prevent emergency evacuation.

National Sentence Text: Exit lighting, exit signs and emergency lighting shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-2.7.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exit lighting, exit signs and emergency lighting shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration or, if applicable, with the more stringent provisions applicable to certain buildings under Section IV of Chapter VIII of the Safety Code. (See Note B-2.7.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting and exit signs shall be maintained in operating condition, in conformance with Section 6.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be maintained in operating condition, in conformance with Section 6.5.

National Sentence Text: Fire emergency procedures conforming to this Section shall be provided for every building containing an assembly, care, treatment or detention occupancy, every building required by the NBC to have a fire alarm system, demolition and construction sites regulated under Section 5.6., storage areas required to have a fire safety plan in conformance with Articles 3.2.2.5.and 3.3.2.9., areas where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored or handled, in conformance with Article 4.1.5.5., and areas where hazardous processes or operations occur, in conformance with Article 5.1.5.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire emergency procedures conforming to this Section shall be provided for every building containing an assembly, care, treatment or detention occupancy, every building required by the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration to have a fire alarm system, demolition and construction sites regulated under Section 5.6., storage areas required to have a fire safety plan in conformance with Articles 3.2.2.5.and 3.3.2.9., areas where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored or handled, in conformance with Article 4.1.5.5., areas where hazardous processes or operations occur, in conformance with Article 5.1.5.1., and every building housing a private seniors’ residence.

National Article Title: Measures in a Fire Safety Plan
National Sentence Text: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared in cooperation with the fire department and other applicable regulatory authorities and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.
P/T Article Title: Measures in a Fire Safety Plan
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.

National Sentence Text: A sufficient number of supervisory staff shall be on duty in care, treatment and detention occupancies to perform the tasks outlined in the fire safety plan described in Clause 2.8.2.1.(1)(a).
P/T Article Title: Care, Treatment and Detention Occupancies and Private Seniors’ Residences
P/T Sentence Text: A sufficient number of supervisory staff shall be on duty in care, treatmentand detention occupanciesand private seniors’ residences to apply the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire detailed in Clause 2.8.2.1.(1)(a).

National Sentence Text: In buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC, the fire safety plan shall, in addition to the requirements of Sentence 2.8.2.1.(1), include the training of supervisory staff in the use of the voice communication system, the procedures for the use of elevators, the action to be taken by supervisory staff in initiating any smoke control or other fire emergency systems installed in a building in the event of fire until the fire department arrives, instructions to the supervisory staff and fire department for the operation of the systems referred to in Clause 2.8.2.4.(1)(c), and the procedures established to facilitate fire department access to the building and fire location within the building.
P/T Sentence Text: In high buildings as defined in the standard applicable at the time of construction or alteration, and in buildings in which any of the following facilities is installed, the fire safety plan shall, in addition to the requirements of Sentence 2.8.2.1.(1), include the training of supervisory staff in the use of the voice communication system, the procedures for the use of elevators, the action to be taken by supervisory staff in initiating any smoke control or other fire emergency systems installed in a building in the event of fire until the fire department arrives, instructions to the supervisory staff and fire department for the operation of the systems referred to in Clause 2.8.2.4.(1)(c), and the procedures established to facilitate fire department access to the building and fire location within the building.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC shall be kept at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: The copy reserved for use by the fire department shall be kept at the central alarm and control facility in the case of a high building as defined in the standard applicable at the time of construction or alteration, at the place determined in cooperation with the fire department in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan for a building or facility within the scope of Sections 3.1., 4.1., and 5.1. shall be kept at the principal entrance to the building or facility.
P/T Sentence Text: In a residential board and care occupancy, a copy of the fire safety plan and a complete list of all occupants, including the location of all occupants with special egress needs, shall be available and kept at a place determined in cooperation with the fire department.

National Sentence Text: In every hotel and motel bedroom, the fire safety rules for occupants shall be posted showing the locations of exits and the paths of travel to exits.
P/T Sentence Text: In every hotel, rooming house and motel bedroom, the fire safety rules for occupants shall be posted showing the locations of exits and the paths of travel to exits.

National Sentence Text: The procedure for conducting fire drills shall be determined by the person in responsible charge of the building, taking into consideration the buildingoccupancy and its fire hazards, the safety features provided in the building, the desirable degree of participation of occupants other than supervisory staff, the number and degree of experience of participating supervisory staff, the features of fire emergency systems installed in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC, and the requirements of the fire department. (See Note A-2.8.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The procedure for conducting fire drills shall be determined by the person in responsible charge of the building, taking into consideration the buildingoccupancy and its fire hazards, the safety features provided in the building, the desirable degree of participation of occupants other than supervisory staff, the number and degree of experience of participating supervisory staff, the features of the fire emergency systems installed in the buildingand subject to additional requirements for high buildings in force at the time of construction or alteration, and the requirements of the fire department. (See Note A-2.8.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.8.3.2.(2), fire drills as described in Sentence 2.8.3.1.(1) shall be held at intervals not greater than 12 months for the supervisory staff, except that in day-care centres and in Group B major occupancies, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than one month, in schools attended by children, total evacuation fire drills shall be held at least 3 times in each of the fall and spring school terms, and in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 2 months.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire drills as described in Sentence 2.8.3.1.(1) shall be held at intervals not greater than 12 months for the supervisory staff, except that in Group B major occupancies and in private seniors’ residences, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 6 months; however, occupants who cannot evacuate the building without assistance or who have health problems are not required to take part in the evacuation, but the supervisory staff shall still prepare them as if they were to be evacuated, in schools and day-care centres, total evacuation drills shall be held at least once in the fall and once in the spring, in high buildings as defined by the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration, except a Group C major occupancybuilding, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 6 months, in Group A, Division 1 major occupancies, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 3 months.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall be designed and installed in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to the NBC.

National Sentence Text: Flame-retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2013 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flame retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2009 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where tents and air-supported structures are designed to accommodate more than 1?000 persons, a fire alarm and emergency communication system shall be provided. (See Note A-2.9.3.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where tents and air-supported structures are designed to accommodate more than 1?000 persons, a fire alarm and emergency communication system shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.5.1.(1), this Part applies to the storage of combustible products and dangerous goods, both inside and outside of buildings. (See Note A-3.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Part applies to the storage of combustible products and dangerous goods, both inside and outside of buildings. (See Note A-3.1.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials shall be stored in conformance with CNSC SOR/2000-209 Nuclear Safety and Control Act (S.C. 1997, c.9)
P/T Sentence Text: Class 7 radioactive materials shall be stored in conformance with CNSC SOR/2000-209 Nuclear Safety and Control Act

National Sentence Text: The storage of dangerous goodsclassified as explosives shall be in conformance with NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act and its Regulations. (See Note A-3.1.1.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: The storage of Class 1 dangerous goods shall be in conformance with NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act (See Note A-3.1.1.4..)

National Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to facilities operated by manufacturers or distributors at whichdangerous goods classified as compressed gases are manufactured, or containers are filled or distributed, provided that storage and handling is in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-3.1.1.4.(1)(a)), and the storage and dispensing of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations covered in Section 4.6.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to facilities operated by manufacturers or distributors at which Class 2 gases are manufactured, or containers are filled or distributed, provided that storage and handling is in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-3.1.1.4.(1)(a)), and the storage and dispensing of Class 2.1 flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations covered in Section 4.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA CAN/CSA-B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of natural gas shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of natural gas shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code (See Note A-3.1.2..)

National Sentence Text: Classes and divisions of dangerous goods referred to in this Code shall mean their primary and first subsidiary classification as defined in Part 2 of TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) or the categories and subcategories established by the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) for controlled products determined in Part 7 of HC SOR/2015-17 Hazardous Products Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: Classes and divisions of dangerous goods referred to in this Code shall mean their primary and first subsidiary classification, as defined in Part 2 of TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR)

National Sentence Text: Substances classified as miscellaneousdangerous goods shall be stored according to the hazard they present based on their properties as dangerous goods.
P/T Sentence Text: Class 9 dangerous goods shall be stored according to the hazard they present based on their properties as dangerous goods.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Code, dangerous goodsclassified as flammable liquids shall mean flammable liquids and combustible liquids as defined in Subsection 4.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Code, Class 3 dangerous goods shall mean flammable liquids and combustible liquids as defined in Subsection 4.1.2.

National Sentence Text: Ammonium nitrate classified as oxidizers and dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall not be stored in an area where the ambient air temperature is higher than 52°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Class 5.1 ammonium nitrate and Class 2 gases shall not be stored in an area where the ambient air temperature is higher than 52°C.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders and tanks of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be protected against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders and tanks of Class 2 gases shall be protected against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases that are in storage shall be protected against valve damage (see Note A-3.1.2.5.(2)(a)), and firmly secured in a position that will not interfere with the operation of the cylinder valve assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of Class 2 gases that are in storage shall be protected against valve damage (see Note A-3.1.2.4.(2)(a)), and firmly secured in a position that will not interfere with the operation of the cylinder valve assembly.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be transported in devices designed to provide restraint against movement in any direction.
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of Class 2 gases shall be transported in devices designed to provide restraint against movement in any direction.

National Sentence Text: Except for portable fire extinguishers, cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall not be stored in any exit or corridor providing access to exits, under any fire escape, outside exit stair, passage or ramp, or within 1 m of any exit. (See Note A-3.1.2.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for portable fire extinguishers, cylinders of Class 2 gases shall not be stored in any exit or corridor providing access to exits, under any fire escape, outside exit stair, passage or ramp, or within 1 m of any exit.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be stored based on their properties when classified as dangerous goods.
P/T Sentence Text: Class 9 dangerous goods shall be stored according to the hazard they present based on their properties as dangerous goods.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials that are unstable and susceptible to reactions, such as polymerization, or self-accelerating decomposition initiated by heat, shock, vibration, light, an increase in pressure, or sound waves, shall be stored in a location and manner that will prevent the undesired reaction.
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive substances that are unstable and susceptible to reactions, such as polymerization, or self-accelerating decomposition initiated by heat, shock, vibration, light or sound waves, shall be stored in a location and manner that will prevent the undesired reaction.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials that may react with water or humidity shall be stored in sealed containers in a dry location.
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive substances that may react with water shall be stored in sealed containers in a dry location.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials that ignite spontaneously in air shall be stored in a liquid that is inert to the material, in an inert atmosphere or in sealed containers.
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive substances that ignite spontaneously in air shall be stored in a liquid that is inert to the material, in an inert atmosphere or in sealed containers.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Code, unstable dangerous goods shall be considered as reactive materials based on their reactive properties.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Code, Class 3 dangerous goods shall mean flammable liquids and combustible liquids as defined in Subsection 4.1.2.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the information required in Section 2.8., where dangerous goods are stored or handled, the fire safety plan shall include the names, addresses and telephone numbers of persons to be contacted in case of fire during non-operating hours.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the information required in Section 2.8., the fire safety plan shall include the location and identification of storage and use areas for specific products, in conformance with Article 3.2.2.5., and the names, addresses and telephone numbers of persons to be contacted in case of fire during non-operating hours.

National Sentence Text: Where the dangerous goods referred to in Sentence 3.1.2.7.(1) consist of dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials, the fire safety plan shall also include methods to control a fire emergency and to recover radioactive materials and equipment containing radioactive materials safely and efficiently, the names, addresses and telephone numbers of primary and alternative sources of expert radiation safety advice and assistance, and the location of primary and alternative sources of radiation survey instruments.
P/T Sentence Text: When the dangerous goods referred to in Sentence 3.1.2.6.(1) consist of Class 7 radioactive materials, the fire safety plan shall also include methods to control a fire emergency and to recover radioactive materials and equipment containing radioactive materials safely and efficiently, the names, addresses and telephone numbers of primary and alternative sources of expert radiation safety advice and assistance, and the location of primary and alternative sources of radiation survey instruments.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.3.1.(2)and 3.1.3.1.(3), the designation, use, maintenance and operation of industrial trucks shall conform to NFPA 505-2013 Powered Industrial Trucks Including Type Designations, Areas of Use, Conversions, Maintenance, and Operations
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.3.1.(2)and 3.1.3.1.(3), the designation, use, maintenance and operation of industrial trucks shall conform to NFPA 505-2011 Powered Industrial Trucks Including Type Designations, Areas of Use, Conversions, Maintenance, and Operations

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C558-14 Guide for the Investigation of Internal Combustion Engine-Powered Industrial Trucks
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C558-2009 Guide for the Investigation of Industrial Trucks, Internal Combustion Engine-Powered

National Sentence Text: Battery-powered industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C583-14 Guide for the Investigation of Electric Battery Powered Industrial Trucks
P/T Sentence Text: Battery-powered industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C583-2009 Guide for the Investigation of Electric Battery Powered Industrial Trucks

National Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks that are fuelled by replaceable propane cylinders are permitted to have their cylinders replaced indoors provided cylinder replacement is done at a safe location that is at least 7.5 m from ignition sources, open pits and underground entrances, the cylinders’ valves are closed, when an automatic quick-closing coupling that closes in both directions when uncoupled is not provided, the engine is operated until the fuel in the system is consumed, and spare propane cylinders are stored in conformance with Subsection 3.3.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-fired industrial trucks that are fuelled by replaceable propane cylinders are permitted to have their cylinders replaced indoors provided cylinder replacement is done at a safe location that is at least 7.5 m from ignition sources, open pits and underground entrances, the cylinders' valves are closed, when an automatic quick-closing coupling that closes in both directions when uncoupled is not provided, the engine is operated until the fuel in the system is consumed, and spare propane cylinders are stored in conformance with Subsection 3.3.5.

National Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.2.(4) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(2), this Section shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings used for the storage of the following products: Class I, II, III and IV commodities, and Group A, B and C plastics, as defined in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(1)(a)), rubber tires and combustible fibres, packaged Level 1, 2 and 3 aerosols, as described in Subsection 3.2.5., dangerous goods in packages or containers, as covered in Subsection 3.2.7., or closed containers of distilled beverage alcohols. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Section shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings used for the short or long term storage of the following products, whether raw materials, waste, products undergoing processing or finished products: Class I, II, III and IV commodities, and Group A, B and C plastics, as defined in NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(1)(a)), rubber tires and combustible fibres, packaged Level 1, 2 and 3 aerosols, as described in Subsection 3.2.5., dangerous goods in packages or containers, as covered in Subsection 3.2.7., or closed containers of distilled beverage alcohols. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: If the top of storage in piles, on shelves, in bin boxes or on racks is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a clear space of not less than 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.
P/T Sentence Text: A clear space of at least 300 mm shall be maintained at all times between stored products and the lower chords of structural framing members.

National Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation conforming to Article 3.3.6.5. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separationhaving a rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.2.4.2.(1).)
A clear space of at least 900 mm shall be maintained between the top of the piles and the sprinkler heads.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Subsection, aerosol products shall be classified as Level 1, 2 or 3 in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (See Note A-3.2.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Subsection, aerosol products shall be classified as Level 1, 2 or 3 in conformance with NFPA 30B-2011 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (See Note A-3.2.5.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where a sprinkler system is required to accommodate the storage limits in Sentence 3.2.5.4.(1), the sprinkler system shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.3.3., with additional sprinkler protection provided in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products for areas in which packaged aerosol products are stored.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a sprinkler system is required to accommodate the storage limits in Sentence 3.2.5.4.(1), the sprinkler system shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.3.3., with additional sprinkler protection provided in conformance with NFPA 30B-2011 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products for areas in which packaged aerosol products are stored.

National Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall conform to Article 3.1.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
The minimum clearance between the top of a pile and a sprinkler head shall be 900 mm.

National Sentence Text: Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system's heat distribution network.
P/T Sentence Text: Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system's heat distribution network. (See Note A-3.2.7.1..)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.7.1.(2) andPart 4. and except as otherwise specified in this Code, this Subsection applies to buildings or parts of buildings where dangerous goods in packages or containers are stored in a single fire compartment.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Part 4. or otherwise specified in this Code, this Subsection shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings where dangerous goods in packages or containers are stored in a single fire compartment in quantities greater than those shown in Table 3.2.7.1.

National Sentence Text: Where a product has multiple classes, the applicable small quantity exemption referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.1.(2) shall be determined using Column A of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Section 2.8 of TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) Column B of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Table A-3.2.7.1.(3)(b), for controlled products under the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) as classified in Part 7 of HC SOR/2015-17 Hazardous Products Regulations (see Note A-3.2.7.1.(3)(b)), or when the class having precedence cannot be established, Column C of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the lesser of the two small quantity exemptions. (See Note A-3.2.7.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a product has a primary and a subsidiary class, the quantities referred to in Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1) shall be determined by using the class having precedence, as established in Section 2.8 of TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) or using the lesser of the two small quantity exemptions in Table 3.2.7.1. when the precedence referred to in Clause 3.2.7.1.(2)(a) is not established.

National Sentence Text: In buildings regulated by Sentence 3.2.7.12.(1), access openings to each storey provided in conformance with the NBC shall be not less than 750 mm wide by 1?100 mm high. (See Note A-3.2.7.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings regulated by Sentence 3.2.7.12.(1), access openings to each storey provided in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration shall be not less than 750 mm wide by 1?100 mm high. (See Note A-3.2.7.12.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Individual storage areas used for the storage of dangerous goodsand laboratories where dangerous goods are used shall be clearly designated as such by posted placards conforming to TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) and Sentences 3.2.7.14.(2)to 3.2.7.14.(4). (See Note A-3.2.7.14.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Individual storage areas used for the storage of dangerous goods shall be clearly designated as such by posted placards conforming to TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) and Sentences 3.2.7.14.(2)to 3.2.7.14.(4). (See Note A-3.2.7.14.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14.(1) consist of a single product, only the UN number need be posted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage consists of a single product, only the UN number need be posted.

National Sentence Text: Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14.(1) consist of multiple products within the same class, the individual class and division placard shall be posted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage consists of multiple products within the same class, the individual class and division placard shall be posted.

National Sentence Text: Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14.(1) consist of more than one class of products, a placard for each individual class, or the "Danger" placard shown in TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) shall be posted at the entrance to the storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage consists of more than one class of products, a placard for each individual class, or the "Danger" placard shown in TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) shall be posted at the entrance to the storage area.

National Sentence Text: The person in responsible charge specified in Sentence 3.2.7.15.(1) shall be trained in the correct procedures for the handling, storing and offering for transport of dangerous goods in accordance with the appropriate federal, provincial, or territorial occupational safety and health regulations, or in the absence of regulations mentioned in Clause 3.2.7.15.(2)(a), TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) or the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS)
P/T Sentence Text: The person in responsible charge specified in Sentence 3.2.7.15.(1) shall be trained in the correct procedures for the handling, storing and offering for transport of dangerous goods in accordance with the appropriate federal, provincial, or territorial occupational safety and health regulations, or in the absence of regulations mentioned in Clause 3.2.7.15.(2)(a), TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) or the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS)

National Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as oxidizers that are located within mercantile occupancies in quantities not exceeding those permitted by Table 3.2.7.1. shall be separated from ordinary combustible material by a distance of at least 1 m.
P/T Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Packing Group I or II oxidizing substances that are located within mercantile occupancies in quantities not exceeding those permitted by Table 3.2.7.1. shall be separated from ordinary combustible material by a distance of at least 1 m.

National Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
National Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 2.4 m shall be maintained between the oxidizing substances identified in Sentence 3.2.7.18.(2) and any other dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.1.2.6.)
P/T Article Title: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: A clear space of not less than 2.4 m shall be maintained between the oxidizing substances identified in Sentence 3.2.7.18.(2) and any other dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.1.2.5.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Heating appliances shall not be permitted in a fire compartment used for the storage of dangerous goodsclassified as flammable gases, flammable liquids, flammable solids, pyrophoric materials, water-reactive substances, oxidizers or organic peroxides, unless they are installed in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating appliances shall not be permitted in a fire compartment used for the storage of Class 2.1, 3, 4 or 5 dangerous goods unless they are installed in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.3. and in Section 5.2., open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used in an area where dangerous goods are stored. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.3. and in Section 5.2., open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used in an area where dangerous goods are stored. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Rooms or parts of buildings used for the storage of dangerous goods shall be dry and cool, and where the products being stored are capable of releasing flammable or toxic gases or vapours under normal ambient conditions, shall be provided with a ventilation system to exhaust such gases or vapours outdoors to an area where they will not return to the building (see Note A-3.2.7.3.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Rooms or parts of buildings used for the storage of dangerous goods shall be dry and cool, and where the products being stored are capable of releasing flammable vapours or toxic gases under normal ambient conditions, shall be provided with a ventilation system to exhaust such vapours or gases outdoors to an area where they will not return to the building (see Note A-3.2.7.3.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: The method of storage of dangerous goods shall be determined to ensure the physical and chemical stability of the stored products, except as provided in Sentences 3.2.7.5.(2)and 3.2.7.5.(5), not exceed the maximum heights of storage shown in Table 3.2.7.5., and not exceed the maximum base areas for individual storage areas shown in Table 3.2.3.2.(see Note A-3.2.7.5.(1)(c)).
P/T Sentence Text: The method of storage of dangerous goods shall be determined to ensure the physical and chemical stability of the stored products, except as provided in Sentences 3.2.7.5.(2)and 3.2.7.5.(5), not exceed the maximum heights of storage shown in Table 3.2.7.5., and not exceed the maximum base areas for individual storage areas shown in Table 3.2.3.2.

National Sentence Text: When a storage area is required by this Article to be protected, it shall be sprinklered or protected with a special fire suppression system, in conformance with Part 2. and good engineering practice with respect to specific dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: When a storage area is required by this Article to be protected, it shall be sprinklered or protected with a special fire suppression system, in conformance with Part 2. and good engineering practice with respect to specific dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.2.7.9.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Stored dangerous goods other than compressed gases shall be kept not less than 100 mm above the floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for Class 2 gases, stored dangerous goods shall be kept not less than 100 mm above the floor level.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Table 3.2.7.6., solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2.(1) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Table 3.2.7.6., solid and liquid Class 5 oxidizing substances shall be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations having a rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive substances shall be separated from the remainder of the buildingby fire separations having a rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.1.2.5.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Packages or containers of dangerous goods classified as organic peroxides shall not be opened, or the product dispensed, in the same area where it is stored.
P/T Sentence Text: Packages or containers of Class 5.2 organic peroxides shall not be opened, or the product dispensed, in the same area where it is stored.

National Sentence Text: Except where the width of storage of dangerous goods is not more than 1.5 m, measured out from the wall, wall clearances of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the width of storage of dangerous goods is not more than 1.5 m, measured out from the wall, wall clearances of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained. (See Note A-3.2.7.6..)

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 3.2.7.6.(3)and 3.2.7.6.(4), Clause 3.2.8.2.(1)(g) and Sentence 3.2.8.3.(2), dangerous goods shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Table 3.2.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentences 3.2.7.6.(2)and 3.2.7.6.(3), Clause 3.2.8.2.(1)(g) and Sentence 3.2.8.3.(2), dangerous goods shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Table 3.2.7.6. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(1).)

National Sentence Text: In addition to the separation requirements in Sentence 3.2.7.6.(1), dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with the information provided in the Safety Data Sheet for the specific dangerous good. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the separation requirements in Sentence 3.2.7.6.(1), dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with the information provided in the Material Safety Data Sheet for the specific dangerous good. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids, combustible liquidsand dangerous goods classified as corrosives shall not be stored with dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials in quantities or in a manner that would constitute an undue risk in the event of a fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids or Class 8 corrosive substances shall not be stored with Class 7 radioactive materials in quantities or in a manner that would constitute an undue risk in the event of a fire.

National Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.7.(1) of Division B of the NBC, and maintained as an impervious membrane.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration, and maintained as an impervious membrane.

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall not be stored on combustible floors or platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: Class 5 oxidizing substances shall not be stored on combustible floors or platforms.

National Sentence Text: Buildings described in Sentence 3.2.7.9.(1) need not be equipped throughout with a sprinkler system or other fire suppression system provided that the sum of individual storage areas in the building used for the storage of dangerous goods, other than substances classified as miscellaneous dangerous goods with no other class and those covered in Part 4., does not exceed 100 m2, and the dangerous goods are separated in conformance with Table 3.2.7.6., and stored in fire compartments separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings described in Sentence 3.2.7.9.(1) need not be equipped throughout with a sprinkler system or other fire suppression system provided that the sum of individual storage areas in the building used for the storage of dangerous goods, other than Class 9 dangerous goods with no other class and those covered in Part 4., does not exceed 100 m2, and the dangerous goods are separated in conformance with Table 3.2.7.6., and stored in fire compartments separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Buildings described in Sentence 3.2.7.9.(1) need not be equipped throughout with a sprinkler system or other fire suppression system, provided that storage consists only of dangerous goods classified as non-flammable, non-toxic gases with no subsidiary class of oxidizing substances.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings described in Sentence 3.2.7.9.(1) need not be equipped throughout with a sprinkler system or other fire suppression system provided that storage consists only of Class 2.2 gases with no Class 5 subsidiary class.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection applies to the indoor storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection shall apply to the storage of Class 2 gases inside buildings.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.8.2.(2)and 3.2.8.2.(3), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3.(1) of Division B of the NBC, is located on an exterior wall of the building, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3.(1) of Division B of the NBC, is designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d)), is provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., does not contain fuel-fired appliances or high-temperature heating elements, and is used for no purpose other than the storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.8.2.(2)and 3.2.8.2.(3), cylinders of Class 2.1 flammable gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the buildingby gas-proof fire separations having a rating of not less than 2 h, is located on an exterior wall of the building, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are equipped with an automatic closing device that ensures that the closures are closed when not in use, and constructed in such a way as to prevent the migration of gas into the remainder of the building, is designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (see Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d)), is provided with natural or mechanical ventilation in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., does not contain fuel-fired appliances or high-temperature heating elements, and is used for no purpose other than the storage of Class 2 gases.

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as flammable, lighter-than-air gases are permitted to be stored outside of a room described in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1), provided the aggregate capacity per fire compartment of expanded gas outside of the room is not more than 60 m3 in an unsprinklered building of combustible construction, and 170 m3 in a sprinkleredbuilding or in a building of noncombustible construction. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of Class 2.1 flammable, lighter-than-air gases are permitted to be stored outside of a room described in Sentence 3.2.8.2.(1) provided that the aggregate capacity per fire compartment of expanded gas outside of the room is not more than 60 m3 in an unsprinklered building of combustible construction, and 170 m3 in a sprinkleredbuilding or in a building of noncombustible construction. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The storage of "single-trip" non-refillable cylinders (i.e. TC-39, TC-2P, and TC-2Q) with water capacities of more than 375 g and less than 1.13 kg located within mercantile occupancies shall conform to the provisions stipulated in CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
P/T Sentence Text: The storage of "single-trip" non-refillable cylinders (i.e. TC-39, TC-2P, and TC-2Q) with water capacities of more than 375 g and less than 1.13 kg located within mercantile occupancies shall conform to the provisions stipulated in CSA CAN/CSA-B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code

National Article Title: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Toxic
National Sentence Text: Cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as toxic or oxidizing gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3.(2) of Division B of the NBC, is located on an exterior wall, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3.(2) of Division B of the NBC, and is provided with ventilation to the outdoors.
P/T Article Title: Indoor Storage of Poisonous, Corrosive or Oxidizing Gases
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of Class 2.3 toxic or corrosive gases or Class 2.2 (5.1) oxidizing gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the buildingby gas-proof fire separations having a rating of not less than 1 h, is located on an exterior wall, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are equipped with an automatic closing device that ensures that the closures are closed when not in use, and constructed in such a way as to prevent the migration of gas into the remainder of the building, and is provided with ventilation to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: The requirements of Subsection 3.2.3. regarding Class II commodities shall also apply to bagged storage of ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(1)(a).)
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Subsection 3.2.3. regarding Class II commodities shall also apply to bagged storage of ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.2.1.1.(1)(a) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The occupancy classification of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6.(1) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupancy classification of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be medium-hazard industrial occupancy.

National Sentence Text: The height of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not exceed 1 storey.

National Sentence Text: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6.(3) of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6.(4) of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6.(6) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed so as to prevent any contact with construction materials that may cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable, corrode or deteriorate after coming into contact with ammonium nitrate, or become saturated with ammonium nitrate.

National Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be constructed of noncombustible materials, as stated in Sentence 3.3.6.6.(5) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be constructed of noncombustible materials.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(2), this Section shall apply to the outdoor storage of the following products: Class III and IV commodities, and Group A, B and C plastics, as described in Section 3.2., rubber tires, forest products, including lumber, timber and wood pallets, forest by-products, including wood chips and hogged material (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(1)(d)), manufactured buildings (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(1)(e)), wrecked vehicles in salvage yards, and dangerous goods in packages or containers, as covered in Subsection 3.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(2), this Section shall apply to the outdoor storage of the following products, whether raw materials, waste, products undergoing processing or finished products: Class III and IV commodities, and Group A, B and C plastics, as described in Section 3.2., rubber tires, forest products, including lumber, timber and wood pallets, forest by-products, including wood chips and hogged material (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(1)(d)), manufactured buildings (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(1)(e)), wrecked vehicles in salvage yards, and dangerous goods in packages or containers, as covered in Subsection 3.3.4.

National Sentence Text: This Section shall not apply to a site where the total storage area is not more than 100 m 2, except for distance requirements between stored products and a building, and requirements for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases in Subsection 3.3.5., Class I and II commodities, as classified in Section 3.2., intermodal shipping containers, except when containing dangerous goods (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(c)), buried products and landfill operations, products stored on the roof of a building, vehicles in parking areas or parking lots, logs and similar untreated forest products in ranked piles (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(g)), or bulk products, except as described in Clause 3.3.1.1.(1)(d).
P/T Sentence Text: This Section shall not apply to a site where the total storage area is not more than 100 m 2, except for distance requirements between stored products and a building, and requirements for Class 2 gases in Subsection 3.3.5., Class I and II commodities, as classified in Section 3.2., intermodal shipping containers, except when containing dangerous goods (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(c)), buried products and landfill operations, products stored on the roof of a building, vehicles in parking areas or parking lots, logs and similar untreated forest products in ranked piles (see Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(g)), or bulk products, except as described in Clause 3.3.1.1.(1)(d).

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.3.3.2.(3)and 3.3.3.2.(4), a clear space of not less than 15 m shall be maintained between stored products and a building on the same property to reduce the risk of fire spreading from the outdoor storage area to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.3.3.2.(3)and 3.3.3.2.(4), a clear space of not less than 15 m shall be maintained between stored products.

National Sentence Text: The storage of dangerous goods in quantities exceeding the maximum exempted amounts stated in Table 3.2.7.1., in a single individual storage area, shall conform to this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage of dangerous goods in quantities greater than those shown in Table 3.2.7.1., in a single individual storage area, shall conform to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Where a product has multiple classes, the applicable small quantity exemption referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.1.(2) shall be determined using Column A of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Section 2.8 of TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) Column B of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the class having precedence, as established in Table A-3.2.7.1.(3)(b), for controlled products under the HC Hazardous Products Act, Part II Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) as classified in Part 7 of HC SOR/2015-17 Hazardous Products Regulations or when the class having precedence cannot be established, Column C of Table 3.2.7.1. based on the lesser of the two small quantity exemptions. (See Note A-3.2.7.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: When a product has a primary and a subsidiary class, the quantities referred to in Sentence 3.3.4.1.(2) shall be determined by using the class having precedence, as established in Section 2.8 of TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) or using the lesser of the two small quantity exemptions in Table 3.2.7.1. when the precedence referred to in Clause 3.3.4.1.(3)(a) is not established.

National Sentence Text: Except for the distance between a building and cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases, a clear space of not less than 6 m shall be provided around each individual storage area for dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.3.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the distance between cylinders of Class 2 gases and a building, a clear space of not less than 6 m shall be provided around each individual storage area for dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.3.3.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Intermodal shipping containers used for the transportation of dangerous goods, as well as their contents, shall be stored in conformance with the segregation requirements stated in IMO 2012 International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (See Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(c).)
P/T Sentence Text: Intermodal shipping containers used for the transportation of dangerous goods, as well as their contents, shall be stored in conformance with the segregation requirements stated in IMO 2010 International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (See Note A-3.3.1.1.(2)(c) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection applies to the outdoor storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection shall apply to the storage of Class 2 gases outside buildings.

National Sentence Text: Where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases are stored outdoors, they shall be supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms, and located in an enclosure fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cylinders of Class 2 gases are stored outdoors, they shall be supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms, and located in an enclosure fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(2), cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as flammable or toxic gases that are stored outdoors shall be not less than 1.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is not more than 170 m3, 7.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is more than 170 m3 but less than 500 m3, and 15 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is 500 m3 or more. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(2), cylinders of Class 2.1 flammable gases or Class 2.3 toxic or corrosive gases stored outdoors shall be not less than 1.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is not more than 170 m3, 7.5 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is more than 170 m3 but less than 500 m3, and 15 m from any building opening, if the aggregate capacity of expanded gas is 500 m3 or more. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(2) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The distances required in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(1) need not apply where the building opening leads into a room conforming to Subsection 3.2.8. that is used for storing dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
P/T Sentence Text: The distances required in Sentence 3.3.5.3.(1) need not apply when the opening referred to is into a room conforming to Subsection 3.2.8. that is used for storing Class 2 gases.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 3.4.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 3.4.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1) in Appendix A.) (See Note A-4.1.1.1..)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.1.1.(2)and 4.1.1.1.(3), this Part applies to the storage, handling, use and processing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings, structures and open areas, and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations. (See Note A-4.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.1.1.(2)and 4.1.1.1.(3), this Part provides for the storage, handling, use and processing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings, structures and open areas. (See Note A-4.1.1.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to the transportation of flammable liquids or combustible liquids under TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) appliances and their ancillary equipment within the scope of CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment (see Note A-4.1.1.1.(3)(b)), the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids on farms for individual farm use and on isolated construction projects, or the storage of aerosol products covered under Subsection 3.2.5.
P/T Sentence Text: This Part shall not apply to the transportation of flammable liquids or combustible liquids under TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) appliances and their ancillary equipment within the scope of CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment (see Note A-4.1.1.1.(3)(b)), the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids on farms for individual farm use and on isolated construction projects, or the storage of aerosol products covered under Subsection 3.2.5.

National Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified, this Section shall apply to all areas involved in the storage, handling or use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids covered in this Part. (See Note A-4.1.2.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless otherwise specified, this Section shall apply to all areas involved in the storage, handling or use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids covered in this Part.

National Sentence Text: When a liquid having a flash point at or above 37.8°C is being processed, stored, handled or used at a temperature at or above its flash point, it shall be treated as a Class I liquid. (See Note A-4.1.2.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: When a liquid having a flash point at or above 37.8°C is being processed, stored, handled or used at a temperature at or above its flash point, it shall be treated as a Class I liquid. (See Note A-4.1.2.3..)

National Sentence Text: When Class I or II liquids are added to the used oils described in Sentence 4.1.2.3.(1), the resulting mixture shall be classified through tests conforming to Subsection 4.1.3., or in the absence of the tests referred to in Clause 4.1.2.3.(2)(a), as a Class IC liquid if Class I liquids are added, or as a Class II liquid if only Class II liquids are added. (See Note A-4.1.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: When Class I or II liquids are added to the used oils described in Sentence 4.1.2.3.(1), the resulting mixture shall be classified through tests conforming to Subsection 4.1.3., or in the absence of the tests referred to in Clause 4.1.2.3.(2)(a), as a Class IC liquid if Class I liquids are added, or as a Class II liquid if only Class II liquids are added. (See Note A-4.1.3.1..)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.3.1.(3)and 4.1.3.1.(4), the flash point of liquids having a kinematic viscosity of 6 cSt or more at 37.8°C or a flash point of 93.3°C or higher shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D 93-13e1 Flash Point by Pensky-Martens Closed Cup Tester
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.3.1.(3)and 4.1.3.1.(4), the flash point of liquids having a kinematic viscosity of 6 cSt or more at 37.8°C or a flash point of 93.3°C or higher shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D 93-11 Flash Point by Pensky-Martens Closed Cup Tester

National Sentence Text: ASTM D 3828-16a Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester is permitted to be used for testing aviation turbine fuels within the scope of this procedure.
P/T Sentence Text: ASTM D 3828-09 Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester is permitted to be used for testing aviation turbine fuels within the scope of this procedure.

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present, electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Notes A-4.1.4.1.(1)and A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present, electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Note A-4.1.4.1.(1)and A-5.1.2.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that reduces to a tolerable level the fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Hot works shall be performed in conformance with Section 5.2. (See Note A-4.1.5.8.)
P/T Sentence Text: Hot works shall be performed in conformance with Section 5.2. (See Note A-4.1.5.8..)

National Sentence Text: Up to 10 L of Class I liquid is permitted to be stored in basements, provided it is stored in safety containers conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than 5 L of Class I liquid is permitted to be stored in basements, provided it is stored in safety containers conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such legislation, to this Part and the NBC. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such legislation, to this Part and the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: When Class I liquids are dispensed from or into a container or a storage tank, all metallic or electrically conducting material in the transfer system shall be electrically bonded and grounded, or if the container or tank is made of non-electrically conducting material, measures shall be taken to minimize the potential for static electric charge to develop (see Note A-4.1.8.2.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: When Class I liquids are dispensed from or into a container or a storage tank, if made of metallic or electrically conducting material, such container or tank shall be electrically connected to the fill stem, or rest on a conductive floor that is electrically connected to the fill stem, or if the container or tank is made of non-electrically conducting material, measures shall be taken to minimize the potential for static electric charge to develop (see Note A-4.1.8.2.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Only enclosed pumping equipment designed in conformance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Only enclosed pumping equipment designed in conformance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks, wooden vats, barrels, drums or containers used for the storage or processing of distilled beverage alcohols shall be designed, fabricated and tested for the anticipated maximum working pressure, operating temperature, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected. (See Note A-4.10.3.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks, wooden vats, barrels, drums or containers used for the storage or processing of distilled beverage alcohols shall be designed, fabricated and tested for the anticipated maximum working pressure, operating temperature, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected. (See Note A-4.10.3.2..)

National Sentence Text: Where a building is sprinklered in conformance with Sentence 2.1.3.1.(1), small hose (38 mm) stations are permitted to be supplied from interior sprinkler piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building is sprinklered in conformance with Article 2.1.3.6., small hose (38 mm) stations are permitted to be supplied from interior sprinkler piping.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.12.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.12.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Storage cabinets required in this Part shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C1275-84 Guide for the Investigation of Storage Cabinets for Flammable Liquid Containers
P/T Sentence Text: Storage cabinets required in this Part shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C1275-84 Storage Cabinets for Flammable Liquid Containers

National Sentence Text: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in stable piles such that they will not collapse under normal operating conditions.

Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored in areas where they may be subject to temperature extremes or atmospheric pressure that could cause their containers to become deformed or rupture, or physical impact or temperature extremes that could cause a chemical reaction or chemical instability such that a fire could occur.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the provisions of this Section, the method of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be determined to ensure the physical and chemical stability of the stored products.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of applying Table 3.2.7.6., Class IIIA and B3 liquids shall be treated as dangerous goods classified as flammable liquids. (See Note A-4.2.2.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of applying Table 3.2.7.6., Class IIIA liquids shall be treated as Class 3 dangerous goods. (See Note A-4.2.2.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.3.3., containers and portable tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be built in conformance with the following: TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) CSA B376-M1980 Portable Containers for Gasoline and Other Petroleum Fuels CSA B306-M1977 Portable Fuel Tanks for Marine Use ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers or CSA B620-14 Highway Tanks and TC Portable Tanks for the Transportation of Dangerous Goods
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 4.2.3.3., containers and portable tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be built in conformance with the following: TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) CSA B376-M1980 Portable Containers for Gasoline and Other Petroleum Fuels CSA B306-M1977 Portable Fuel Tanks for Marine Use ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers or CSA B620-09 Highway Tanks and Portable Tanks for the Transportation of Dangerous Goods

National Sentence Text: Markings referred to in Sentence 4.2.3.2.(1) are not required when the container is labelled in conformance with TC SOR/2016-95 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) HC R.S.C., 1985, c. H-3 Hazardous Products Act or HC S.C. 2002, c. 28 Pest Control Products Act
P/T Sentence Text: Markings referred to in Sentence 4.2.3.2.(1) are not required when the container is labelled in conformance with TC SOR/2001-286 Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations (TDGR) HC R.S.C., 1985, c. H-3 Hazardous Products Act or HC 2002, c. 28 Pest Control Products Act

National Sentence Text: The storage cabinets referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2.(4) shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: The storage cabinets and rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2.(4) shall not be located above or below the first storey.

National Sentence Text: The location of storage rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2.(4) shall conform to Article 3.3.2.16. and Sentence 3.3.4.3.(4) of Division B of the NBC.

Except as provided in Subsection 4.2.12. regarding self-service storage buildings, this Subsection applies to the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in closed containers in industrial occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in closed containers in industrial occupancies.
