National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of building is designed for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, there is no limit on the total quantity of storage per fire compartment provided the building or part of building is separated from adjacent buildings or parts of buildings by a firewall having a fire-resistance rating of at least 4 h, or spatial separation in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-4.2.7.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or part of building is designed for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, there is no limit on the total quantity of storage per fire compartment provided the building or part of building is separated from adjacent buildings or parts of buildings by a firewall having a fire-resistance rating of at least 4 h, or spatial separation in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration. (See Note A-4.2.7.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Areas in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred from one container or storage tank to another, or where they are used in such a way as to release potentially explosive concentrations of flammable vapours, shall be separated from possible sources of ignition by a spatial separation of not less than 6 m, or by a fire separation. (See Note A-4.2.8.3.(1).) (See also Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Areas in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred from one container or storage tank to another, or where they are used in such a way as to release potentially explosive concentrations of flammable vapours, shall be separated from possible sources of ignition by a spatial separation of not less than 6 m, or by a fire separation. (See Note A-4.2.8.3.(1).) (See also Note A-4.1.5.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than that permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.5.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than that permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.5.-A

National Sentence Text: Dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from containers having a capacity of more than 30 L shall be by pumps or through self-closing valves, designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from containers having a capacity of more than 30 L shall be by pumps or through self-closing valves, designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.3.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.4.(2) of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with good practice, as set out in NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for aboveground use in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in API 653-2009 Tank Inspection, Repair, Alteration, and Reconstruction and STI SP031-2008 Repair of Shop Fabricated Aboveground Tanks for Storage of Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for aboveground use in conformance with one of the following standards: ULC ULC-S601(A)-2001 Refurbishing of Steel Aboveground Horizontal Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S630(A)-2001 Refurbishing of Steel Aboveground Vertical Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for underground use in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in ULC CAN/ULC-S669-14 Internal Retrofit Systems for Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids (See Note A-4.3.1.10.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank is permitted to be refurbished for underground use in conformance with one of the following standards: ULC ULC-S603(A)-2001 Refurbishing of Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S615(A)-2002 Refurbishing of Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids (See Note A-4.3.1.10.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(3) and in Section 4.10., atmospheric storage tanks shall be built in conformance with the following: except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12B-2008 Bolted Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12D-2008 Field Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(2), API 12F-2008 Shop Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids API 650-2013 Welded Tanks for Oil Storage ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S602-14 Aboveground Steel Tanks for Fuel Oil and Lubricating Oil ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S652-16 Tank Assemblies for the Collection, Storage and Removal of Used Oil ULC CAN/ULC-S653-16 Aboveground Steel Contained Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S677-14 Fire Tested Aboveground Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC ULC/ORD-C80.1-12 Non-metallic Tank for Oil Burner Fuels and Other Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(3) and in Section 4.10., atmospheric storage tanks shall be built in conformance with the following: API ANSI/API 12B-2008 Bolted Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids API 12D-2008 Field Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids API 12F-2008 Shop Welded Tanks for Storage of Production Liquids API 650-2007 Welded Tanks for Oil Storage ULC CAN/ULC-S601-07 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S602-07 Aboveground Steel Tanks for Fuel Oil and Lubricating Oil ULC ULC-S603-00 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S615-98 Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC CAN/ULC-S652-08 Tank Assemblies for the Collection, Storage and Removal of Used Oil ULC CAN/ULC-S653-06 Aboveground Steel Contained Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC ULC/ORD-C142.5-1992 Concrete Encased Steel Aboveground Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Tanks built in conformance with Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(a), 4.3.1.2.(1)(b)or 4.3.1.2.(1)(c) shall be used only for the storage of crude petroleum and oil field production liquids, and provided with emergency venting that (see Note A-4.3.1.2.(2)(b)) conforms to API 2000-2009 Venting Atmospheric and Low-Pressure Storage Tanks and is compatible with the design features of the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Tanks built in conformance with Clauses 4.3.1.2.(1)(a), 4.3.1.2.(1)(b)and 4.3.1.2.(1)(c) shall be used only for the storage of crude petroleum at oil fields.

National Sentence Text: When necessitated by possible contamination of the liquid to be stored or possible rapid corrosion of the tank, storage tanks need not conform to Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), provided that they are designed and built in conformance with good engineering practice for the material being used. (See Note A-4.3.1.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: When necessitated by possible contamination of the liquid to be stored or possible rapid corrosion of the tank, storage tanks need not conform to Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1), provided that they are designed and built in conformance with good engineering practice for the material being used.

National Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
National Sentence Text: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with API 620-2013 Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
P/T Sentence Text: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with API 620-2008 Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or ASME BPVC-2010 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code

National Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
National Sentence Text: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code
P/T Article Title: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
P/T Sentence Text: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA B51-09 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code

National Sentence Text: Aboveground storage tanks and their integral fittings that are subject to corrosion shall be protected by any means against exposure to conditions that would initiate corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposed surface of every aboveground storage tank for flammable liquids or combustible liquids that is fabricated of any ferrous substance shall be thoroughly coated with a rust-resisting material that is compatible with the tank.

National Sentence Text: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CPPI 1990 Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), a storage tank shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing continuous supervision of the filling operations by personnel qualified to supervise such operations, or an overfill protection device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (see Note A-4.3.1.8.(1)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), a storage tank shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing continuous supervision of the filling operations by personnel qualified to supervise such operations, or an overfill protection device conforming to ULC ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (see Note A-4.3.1.8.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: Tight-filled storage tanks shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing a positive shut-off device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (See Note A-4.3.1.8.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Tight-filled storage tanks shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing a positive shut-off device conforming to ULC ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (See Note A-4.3.1.8.(2).)

National Sentence Text: The fill point of an underground storage tank shall not be located higher than the discharge point of the tank's vent.
P/T Sentence Text: The fill point of an underground storage tank shall not be located higher than the discharge point of the tank’s vent.

National Sentence Text: Installations using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to NFPA 37-2015 Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines
P/T Sentence Text: Installations using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to NFPA 37-2010 Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines

National Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where Class IA or IB liquids are dispensed within a storage room, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where firefighting access to storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids is not provided, fire extinguishing measures conforming to Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2) shall be provided. (See Note A-4.3.2.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where firefighting access to storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids is not provided, fire extinguishing measures conforming to Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2) shall be provided. (See Note A-4.3.2.5..)

National Sentence Text: Protection against fires or explosions required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 11-2016 Low-, Medium-, and High-Expansion Foam NFPA 15-2012 Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection and NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Protection against fires or explosions required for a storage tank shall consist of fixed protection systems designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 11-2010 Low-, Medium-, and High-Expansion Foam NFPA 15-2012 Water Spray Fixed Systems for Fire Protection and NFPA 69-2008 Explosion Prevention Systems

National Sentence Text: Where the clearance below the base of the tank exceeds 300 mm, tank supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the clearance below the base of the tank exceeds300 mm, tank supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.

National Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with Part 4 of Division B of the NBC, and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration, and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-07 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: A membrane providing the level of impermeability required in Clause 4.3.7.2.(1)(b) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S668-12 Liners Used for Secondary Containment of Aboveground Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tanks and if it is combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material that will prevent the membrane from failing in the event that the secondary containment is exposed to fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a membrane providing the level of impermeability required in Clause 4.3.7.2.(1)(b) is combustible, it shall be covered with a noncombustible material of such nature and thickness that the membrane will not fail when the secondary containment is exposed to fire.

National Sentence Text: Where piping passes through a secondary containment, such passages shall conform to Sentences 4.3.7.2.(1)and 4.3.7.2.(2). (See Note A-4.1.6.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping passes through a secondary containment, such passages shall conform to Sentences 4.3.7.2.(1)and 4.3.7.2.(2). (See Note A-4.1.6.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The distance required in Sentence 4.3.7.4.(1) is permitted to be waived, provided the storage tank has a capacity of not more than 80 000 L and is constructed in accordance with Clauses 4.3.1.2.(1)(j), 4.3.1.2.(1)(k)or 4.3.1.2.(1)(m), incorporating secondary containment, or Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(e) for double-walled storage tanks, or conforms to ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: It is permitted to waive the distance required in Sentence 4.3.7.4.(1) provided the storage tank is constructed in accordance with Clauses 4.3.1.2.(1)(j), 4.3.1.2.(1)(k), 4.3.1.2.(1)(l)or 4.3.1.2.(1)(m), incorporating secondary containment, or Clause 4.3.1.2.(1)(e) for double-walled storage tanks, has a capacity of not more than 50?000 L, and is protected by posts or guardrails when exposed to collision damage.

National Article Title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provisions shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m, measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall. (See Note A-4.3.7.5.(2).)
P/T Article Title: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank contains Class I liquids, provisions shall be made for the normal operation of valves and for access to the storage tank roof without entering the contained space created by the secondary containment when the average height of the secondary containment exceeds 3.5 m , measured from the ground level of the interior of the contained area, or the distance between the tank shell and the top inside edge of the secondary containment wall is less than the height of this wall. (See Note A-4.3.7.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Underground reinforced plastic storage tanks shall be installed in conformance with Appendix A of ULC ULC-S615-98 Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Article 4.3.9.2., the sumps referred to in Sentences 4.3.9.1.(1)to 4.3.9.1.(4) shall be installed in conformance with the sump manufacturer's instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of Article 4.3.9.2., the sumps referred to in Sentences 4.3.9.1.(1)to 4.3.9.1.(4) shall be installed in conformance with the sump manufacturer’s instructions.

National Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Where inventory reconciliation is performed using automatic tank gauging referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1.(2), the system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test when a leak is suspected in conformance with Table 4.4.1.2.-A. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(5).)
P/T Article Title: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring Methods
P/T Sentence Text: Where inventory reconciliation is performed using automatic tank gauging referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1.(2), the system shall conform to good engineering practice and meet the requirements of a precision leak detection test when a leak is suspected in conformance with Table 4.4.1.2.-A (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S603-14 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC CAN/ULC-S615-14 Fibre Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pneumatic leak detection test is conducted before an underground storage tank is backfilled, in the case of a new tank, or after the tank is uncovered, in the case of a previously installed tank, the test pressure shall be in conformance with the production testing requirements of ULC ULC-S603-00 Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC ULC-S615-98 Reinforced Plastic Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Article Title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps
National Sentence Text: The minimum duration of the test shall be 1 h with no visual or measured evidence of leakage. (See Note A-4.4.4.1.)
P/T Article Title: Protocols for Leak Detection Testing of Sumps
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum duration of the test shall be 1 hwith no visual or measured evidence of leakage. (See Note A-4.4.4.1..)

National Sentence Text: The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.5.10.7.(6).) (See Note A-4.6.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.5.10.7.(6).) (See Note A-4.6.1.1..)

National Sentence Text: Non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The use of non-metallic piping shall be permitted in underground installations if it conforms to one of the following standards: ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC/ORD-C107.4 Ducted Flexible Underground Piping Systems for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC/ORD-C107.7 Glass Fibre Reinforced Plastic Pipe and Fittings for Flammable and Combustible Liquids ULC ULC/ORD-C107.19 Secondary Containment of Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or ULC ULC/ORD-C971 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(6), where steel piping is used, it shall conform to API 5L-2012 Line Pipe ASTM A 53/A 53M-12 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless or CSA Z245.1-14 Steel Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.2.1.(5), where steel piping is used, it shall conform to API ANSI/API 5L-2007 Line Pipe ASTM A 53/A 53M-10 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless or CSA Z245.1-07 Steel Pipe

National Sentence Text: Where service pressures exceeding 875 kPa (gauge) may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in conformance with ASME B31.3-2016 Process Piping
P/T Sentence Text: Where service pressures exceeding 875 kPa (gauge) may occur, piping and fittings shall be designed in conformance with ASME B31.3-2010 Process Piping

National Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or NACE SP0169-2013 Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Underground metallic piping systems in contact with the soil or groundwater shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S603.1-11 External Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids or NACE SP0169-2007 Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems

National Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: Transfer points in piping systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be identified in conformance with CPPI 1990 Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification

National Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-16 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-07 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints

National Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to Section 5.2. and to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to API 1104-2013 Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities
P/T Sentence Text: Welding of piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to Section 5.2. and to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to API 1104-2005 Welding of Pipelines and Related Facilities

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2009 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard

National Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-16 Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.
P/T Sentence Text: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-11a Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.

National Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650°C without damage that would impair their function. (See Note A-4.5.5.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650°C without damage that would impair their function. (See Note A-4.5.5.6..)

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10.(1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10.(1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be equipped with positive ventilation vented directly to the outside air, or be designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.

National Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S633-99 Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C536-1998 Flexible Metallic Hose are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S633-99 Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C536-1998 Flexible Metallic Hose are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-16 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-07 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Every emergency valve shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S651-16 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every emergency valve shall conform to ULC ULC-S651-07 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: All valves shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: All valves shall be identified in conformance with CPPI 1990 Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification

National Sentence Text: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration.

National Sentence Text: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1) shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Sentence Text: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1) shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2010 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred as a result of displacement by the expansion of nitrogen, carbon dioxide or other inert gases, all pressure vessels involved shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred as a result of displacement by the expansion of nitrogen, carbon dioxide or other inert gases, all pressure vessels involved shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2010 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids and Class 2.1 gases at fuel-dispensing stations.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Section, the storage and dispensing ofdangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations shall conform to CSA B108-14 Compressed Natural Gas Fuelling Stations Installation Code CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Section, the storage and dispensing of Class 2.1 flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B108-99 Natural Gas Fuelling Stations Installation Code CSA CAN/CSA-B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA CAN/CSA-B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code

National Sentence Text: Outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be provided with physical protection against collision damage, measures to prevent unauthorized access to the storage tank and its ancillary equipment, measures to contain accidental spillage in conformance with Subsection 4.3.7., an overfill protection device in conformance with Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), where a tight-filled connection is provided, and where the piping is connected to the storage tank at a point that is lower than the maximum fill level, an external valve to prevent gravity discharge in the event the piping is severed.
P/T Sentence Text: Outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be provided with physical protection against collision damage, measures to prevent unauthorized access to the storage tank and its ancillary equipment, measures to contain accidental spillage in conformance with Subsection 4.3.7., and an overfill protection device in conformance with Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), where a tight-filled connection is provided.

National Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be installed inside a building when the building is not open to the public, the dispensers are located on the first storey, drainage is provided, and ventilation is provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7. and with the requirements for storage garages in Subsection 6.3.1. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be installed inside a building when the building is not open to the public, the dispensers are located on the first storey, drainage is provided, and ventilation is provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7. and with the requirements for storage garages in Subsection 6.2.2. of Division B of the NBC.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.4.2.(2) and in addition to the device required by Sentence 4.6.4.1.(1), an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of fuel at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in Sentence 4.6.8.2.(2) so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.4.2.(2) and in addition to the device required by Sentence 4.6.4.1.(1), an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of liquid at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in Sentence 4.6.8.2.(2) so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.

National Sentence Text: Delivery hose shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S612-16 Hose and Hose Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Delivery hose shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S612-07 Hose and Hose Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall be automatic closing as required in Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2), and conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-16 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall be automatic closing as required in Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2), and conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-07 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: When a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is used at an attended self-service outlet, a break-away coupling conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S644-16 Emergency Breakaway Fittings for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: When a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is used at an attended self-service outlet, a break-away coupling conforming to ULC ULC-S644-00 Emergency Breakaway Fittings for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: An emergency valve conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S651-16 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be installed in the supply line so that the shear point of the valve is at a level not higher than the base of the dispenser nor more than 25 mm below it.
P/T Sentence Text: An emergency valve conforming to ULC ULC-S651-07 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be installed in the supply line so that the shear point of the valve is at a level not higher than the base of the dispenser nor more than 25 mm below it.

National Sentence Text: Piping between storage tanks located on shore and dispensers at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall conform to Section 4.5., except that where dispensing is from a floating structure, it is permitted to use suitable lengths of flexible hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice between the piping on shore and the piping on the floating structure. (See Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping between storage tanks located on shore and dispensers at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall conform to Section 4.5., except that where dispensing is from a floating structure, it is permitted to use suitable lengths of flexible hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice between the piping on shore and the piping on the floating structure. (See Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Attendants on duty at fuel-dispensing stations shall supervise the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, activate the controls to permit the dispensing of fuel at an individual dispenser only after the customer at the unit is ready to activate the nozzle, prevent the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids into containers that do not conform to Article 4.2.3.1., or are in a vehicle, take appropriate measures to prevent sources of ignition from creating a hazard at the dispensers, take appropriate action in the event of a spill to reduce the risk of fire, shut off the power to all dispensers in the event of a spill or fire, and perform routine visual inspections in accordance with Article 4.5.10.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Attendants on duty at fuel-dispensing stations shall supervise the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, activate the controls to permit the dispensing of fuel at an individual dispenser only after the customer at the unit is ready to activate the nozzle, prevent the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids into containers that do not conform to Article 4.2.3.1., or are in a vehicle, take appropriate measures to prevent sources of ignition from creating a hazard at the dispensers, take appropriate action in the event of a spill to reduce the risk of fire, and shut off the power to all dispensers in the event of a spill or fire.

National Article Title: Dispensing into Metal Containers or Tanks
National Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be dispensed into a metal container or storage tank unless it is electrically connected in conformance with Article 4.1.8.2. (See Note A-4.7.4.)
P/T Article Title: Dispensing into Metal Containers or Tanks
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be dispensed into a metal container or storage tank unless it is electrically connected in conformance with Article 4.1.8.2. (See Note A-4.7.4..)

National Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence 4.7.4.4.(1) shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments. (See Note A-4.7.4.4.(2).) (See Note A-4.7.4.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence 4.7.4.4.(1) shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments. (See Note A-4.7.4.4.(2).) (See Note A-4.7.4.5..)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.9.4.2., where Class IA liquids or unstable liquids are processed within a room or a building, the room or building shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.9.4.2., where Class IA liquids or unstable liquids are processed within a room or a building, the room or building shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Areas where unstable liquids are handled or where small scale unit chemical processes occur shall conform to Article 3.3.6.8. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Areas where unstable liquids are handled or where small scale unit chemical processes occur shall be isolated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69-2008 Explosion Prevention Systems

National Sentence Text: Where the process warrants protection, process plants shall be supplied with water supplies of adequate pressure and quantity to meet the probable fire demands, hydrants, hoses connected to a permanent water supply and located so that all equipment containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including pumps, can be reached with at least one hose stream, and fire protection systems conforming to Part 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the process warrants such protection, industrial process plants shall be supplied with water supplies of adequate pressure and quantity to meet the probable fire demands, hydrants, hoses connected to a permanent water supply and located so that all equipment containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including pumps, can be reached with at least one hose stream, nozzles capable of discharging a water spray, and automatic fire suppression systems.

National Sentence Text: The manufacturing, handling, transportation, sale and use of dangerous goodsclassified as explosives shall be in conformance with NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act and its Regulations.
P/T Sentence Text: The manufacturing, handling, transportation, sale and use of Class 1 dangerous goods shall be in conformance with NRCan R.S.C., 1985, c. E-17 Explosives Act (See Note A-5.1.1.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the NBC and with this Part.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration and with this Part.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the information required in Sentence 5.1.5.1.(2), where dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials are used or handled, the fire safety plan shall include the information specified in Subsection 3.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the information required in Sentence 5.1.5.1.(2), where Class 7 radioactive materials are used or handled, the fire safety plan shall include the information specified in Subsection 3.1.2.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to hot works involving open flames or producing heat or sparks, including but not limited to, cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, roofing operations, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section shall apply to hot works involving open flames or producing heat or sparks, including, without being limited to, cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Section, hot works described in Sentence 5.2.1.1.(1) shall conform to CSA W117.2-12 Safety in Welding, Cutting and Allied Processes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in this Section, hot works described in Sentence 5.2.1.1.(1) shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-W117.2-06 Safety in Welding, Cutting and Allied Processes

National Sentence Text: All valves shall be closed and gas lines bled when hot work equipment using dangerous goods classified as compressed gases is not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: All valves shall be closed and gas lines bled when Class 2 gas hot work equipment is not in use.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of oxygen-fuel gas equipment shall conform to NFPA 51-2018 Design and Installation of Oxygen-Fuel Gas Systems for Welding, Cutting, and Allied Processes
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of oxygen-fuel gas equipment shall conform to NFPA 51-2007 Design and Installation of Oxygen-Fuel Gas Systems for Welding, Cutting, and Allied Processes

National Sentence Text: Cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall conform to Part 3..
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of Class 2 gases shall conform to Part 3..

National Sentence Text: When it is not practicable to undertake hot work in an area described in Sentence 5.2.3.1.(1), combustible and flammable materials within a 15 m distance from the hot work shall be protected against ignition in conformance with Article 5.2.3.2., a continuous fire watch shall be provided during the hot work and for a period of not less than 60 min after its completion in conformance with Article 5.2.3.3., and a final inspection of the hot work area and adjacent exposed areas shall be conducted 4 h after completion of the work, or after completion of the fire watch required in Clause 5.2.3.1.(2)(b), in which case, a more comprehensive inspection shall be conducted (see Note A-5.2.3.1.(2)(c)(ii)).
P/T Sentence Text: When it is not practicable to undertake hot work in an area described in Sentence 5.2.3.1.(1), combustible and flammable materials within a 15 m distance from the hot work shall be protected against ignition in conformance with Article 5.2.3.2., a fire watch shall be provided during the hot work and for a period of not less than 60 min after its completion in conformance with Article 5.2.3.3., and a final inspection of the hot work area shall be conducted 4 h after completion of work.

National Sentence Text: When there is a possibility of sparks or open flames reaching combustible materials in areas adjacent to the area where hot work is carried out, openings in walls, floors or ceilings shall be covered or closed to prevent the passage of sparks or open flames to such adjacent areas, or Sentence 5.2.3.1.(2) shall apply to such adjacent areas.
P/T Sentence Text: When there is a possibility of sparks leaking onto combustible materials in areas adjacent to the area where hot work is carried out, openings in walls, floors or ceilings shall be covered or closed to prevent the passage of sparks to such adjacent areas, or Sentence 5.2.3.1.(2) shall apply to such adjacent areas.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: Any combustible and flammable material, dust or residue shall be removed from the area where hot work is carried out, or except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(2), protected against ignition by the use of noncombustible materials.
P/T Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Any combustible and flammable material, dust or residue shall be removed from the area where hot work is carried out, or protected against ignition by the use of noncombustible materials.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: Combustible materials or building surfaces that cannot be removed or protected against ignition as required in Clause 5.2.3.2.(1)(b) shall be thoroughly wetted where hot work is carried out.
P/T Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible materials or building surfaces that cannot be removed or protected against ignition as required in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(1) shall be thoroughly wetted where hot work is carried out.

National Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
National Sentence Text: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.
P/T Article Title: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
P/T Sentence Text: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.

National Sentence Text: The exposed areas described in Sentences 5.2.3.1.(2)and 5.2.3.1.(3) shall be continuously examined for ignition of combustible materials by personnel equipped with and trained in the use of fire extinguishing equipment. (See Note A-5.2.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The exposed areas described in Sentences 5.2.3.1.(2)and 5.2.3.1.(3) shall be examined for ignition of combustible materials by personnel equipped with and trained in the use of fire extinguishing equipment.

National Article Title: Work on Containers, Equipment or Piping
National Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on containers, equipment, or piping containing flammable liquids, combustible liquids or dangerous goods classified as flammable gases unless they have been cleaned and tested with a gas detector to ascertain that they are free of explosive vapours, or safety measures are taken in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-5.2.3.4.(1)(b)).
P/T Article Title: Work on Containers, Equipment or Piping
P/T Sentence Text: Hot work shall not be performed on containers, equipment, or piping containing flammable liquids, combustible liquids or Class 2.1 flammable gases unless they have been cleaned and tested with a gas detector to ascertain that they are free of explosive vapours, or safety measures are taken in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-5.2.3.4.(1)(b)).

National Sentence Text: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing dangerous goods classified as flammable gases, the piping shall conform to Sentence 5.2.3.4.(1), or be protected by a thermal barrier against the passage of heat.
P/T Sentence Text: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing a Class 2.1 flammable gas, the piping shall conform to Sentence 5.2.3.4.(1), or be protected by a thermal barrier against the passage of heat.

National Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A dust-collecting system required in Sentence 5.3.1.3.(1) shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice, be made of noncombustible materials, and not create sparks upon physical contact in the fan assembly. (See Note A-5.3.1.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A dust-collecting system required in Sentence 5.3.1.3.(1) shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 664-2012 Prevention of Fires and Explosions in Wood Processing and Woodworking Facilities and the NFPA standards on dust explosion hazards, and shall be made of noncombustible materials, and not create sparks upon physical contact in the fan assembly. (See Note A-5.3.1.3.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.4.(2), a dust collector having a capacity greater than 2.36 m3/s shall be located outside of a building, and be equipped with explosion venting to the outdoors of not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.4.(2), a dust collector having a capacity greater than 0.5 m3/s shall be located outside of a building, and be equipped with explosion venting to the outdoors of not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.

National Sentence Text: When explosion venting is required in this Section, it shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage to the building in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: When explosion venting is required in this Section, it shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage to the building in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 68-2007 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
P/T Sentence Text: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 69-2008 Explosion Prevention Systems

National Sentence Text: Nozzles for standpipe and hose systems shall conform to Sentence 3.2.5.11.(7) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Nozzles for the standpipe and hose systems shall be of the fog and fine spray type to prevent combustible dust from being driven up by a powerful jet and remaining suspended.

National Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to baking and drying processes shall conform to NFPA 86-2015 Ovens and Furnaces
P/T Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to baking and drying processes shall conform to NFPA 86-2011 Ovens and Furnaces

National Sentence Text: Dry cleaning plants shall conform to NFPA 32-2016 Drycleaning Plants
P/T Sentence Text: Dry cleaning plants shall conform to NFPA 32-2011 Drycleaning Plants

National Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to spray coating processes shall conform to NFPA 33-2016 Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials
P/T Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to spray coating processes shall conform to NFPA 33-2011 Spray Application Using Flammable or Combustible Materials

National Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to dipping and coating processes shall conform to NFPA 34-2015 Dipping, Coating, and Printing Processes Using Flammable or Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: The design, operation and maintenance requirements relating to dipping and coating processes shall conform to NFPA 34-2011 Dipping and Coating Processes Using Flammable or Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Section, the use, handling and storage of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, shall conform to Parts 3., 4.and 5..
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specified in this Section, the use, handling and storage of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, shall conform to Parts 3., 4.and 5., or in the case of a laboratory to which Sentence 5.5.2.2.(2) applies, to NFPA 45-2011 Fire Protection for Laboratories Using Chemicals

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by fire separations conforming to this Code and the NBC, but having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.2.2.(2), a laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by fire separations conforming to this Code and the requirements in force at the time of construction or alteration, but having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.8.3.2.(2)to 5.5.3.1.(5), a laboratory shall conform to the requirements for emergency planning in Section 2.8. and for a fire safety plan in Subsection 5.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 5.5.3.1.(2)to 5.5.3.1.(6), a laboratory shall conform to the requirements for emergency planning in Section 2.8. and for a fire safety plan in Subsection 5.1.5.

National Sentence Text: Personnel working in a laboratory shall be trained in the safe handling and use of dangerous goods, in conformance with Article 3.2.7.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Personnel working in a laboratory shall be trained in the safe handling and use of dangerous goods, in conformance with Article 3.2.7.15.

National Sentence Text: Dangerous goods shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.13.
P/T Sentence Text: Dangerous goods shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.13.

National Sentence Text: The laboratory shall be clearly designated as an area containing dangerous goods in conformance with Article 3.2.7.14.
P/T Sentence Text: The laboratory shall be clearly designated as an area containing dangerous goods in conformance with Article 3.2.7.14.

National Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to prevent access to the laboratory by unauthorized persons.
P/T Sentence Text: Measures shall be taken to prevent access to the laboratory by unauthorized persons.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.3.5.(3), electrical equipment located in areas where the concentration of flammable vapours is sufficient to create a hazard shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for the hazardous locations. (See Note A-5.5.3.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.3.5.(3), electrical equipment located in areas where the concentration of flammable vapours is sufficient to create a hazard shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for the hazardous locations.

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation that is designed in conformance with Article 6.3.4.2. of Division B of the NBC, and maintained to ensure it fulfills the function for which it was designed.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation that is designed and maintained in a manner that ensures that the vapours and particles produced by dangerous goods do not accumulate in the laboratory, do not spread to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation ducts, are vented to the outside, and cannot re-enter the building.

National Sentence Text: The use of dangerous goods in a laboratory shall be confined inside a power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 6.3.4.3. and 6.3.4.4. of Division B of the NBC when their use releases flammable vapours or causes runaway or potentially explosive reactions, liquids are heated to a temperature equal to or greater than their flash point, or Class I liquids or unstable liquids are used.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.4.2.(3), the use of dangerous goods in a laboratory shall be confined inside a power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 5.5.4.3. and Article 5.5.4.4. when their use releases flammable vapours or causes runaway or potentially explosive reactions, liquids are heated to a temperature equal to or greater than their flash point, or Class I liquids or unstable liquids are used.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.4.3.(2), the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. shall conform to Article 6.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. shall conform to NFPA 45-2011 Fire Protection for Laboratories Using Chemicals ensure the continuous extraction of air at a rate sufficient to prevent the formation of combustible or reactive deposits inside the enclosure or the exhaust ducts, confine vapours and particles of dangerous goods to the place where they are produced and vent them to the outside, prevent the re-entry of extracted air to the building, and be equipped with clearly identified control switches located outside the power-ventilated enclosure, and accessible in an emergency.

National Sentence Text: Where combustible or reactive deposits can accumulate in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard, provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or an automatic fire suppression system shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where combustible or reactive deposits can accumulate in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard, provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or an automatic fire suppression system shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. and its exhaust duct system shall conform to Article 6.3.4.4. of Division B of the NBC and be provided with instructions for its use and the operation of the ventilation system, and be provided with means to control accidental spillage.
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 5.5.4.4.(2)and 5.5.4.4.(3), be constructed of incombustible materials that are compatible to the vapours and particles produced by the dangerous goods and resistant to chemical attack, include inspection hatches for the inspection and maintenance of fans and ducts, be provided with instructions for its use and the operation of the ventilation system, and be provided with means to control accidental spillage.

National Sentence Text: The quantity of dangerous goods kept in a laboratory shall be minimized and shall not exceed the lesser of the supply necessary for normal operation, or when located in a Group A, Division 2 educational or a Group D major occupancy, 300 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 50 L shall be Class I liquids, or a Group B major occupancy, the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(1). (See Note A-5.5.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.5.1.(4), the quantity of dangerous goods kept in a laboratory shall be minimized and shall not exceed the lesser of the supply necessary for normal operation, or when located in a Group A, Division 2 educational or a Group D major occupancy, 300 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 50 L shall be Class I liquids, or a Group B major occupancy, the quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(1). (See Note A-5.5.5.1.(1).)

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 5.5.5.2.(2)and 5.5.5.2.(4), containers used for the storage or dispensing of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a laboratory shall conform to Subsection 4.2.3.
P/T Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 5.5.5.2.(2), 5.5.5.2.(3)and 5.5.5.2.(4), flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a laboratory shall be kept in containers conforming to Subsection 4.2.3.

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Where Class I liquids are required to be kept in individual storage or dispensing containers having a capacity greater than 5 L in a laboratory, such containers shall be safety containers conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers and have a capacity of not more than 25 L.
P/T Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Where Class I liquids are required to be kept in individual containers having a capacity greater than 5 L in a laboratory, such containers shall be safety containers conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C30-1995 Safety Containers and have a capacity of not more than 25 L.

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Containers used for the preservation of animal, human or plant specimens that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be properly sized for the specimens, be stored in a room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9., and be protected against breakage and spillage.
P/T Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Containers of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be kept closed when not in use.

National Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
National Sentence Text: Containers of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be kept closed when not in use.
P/T Article Title: Containers for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: In a laboratory referred to in Sentence 5.5.2.2.(2), flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in recipients that conform to NFPA 45-2011 Fire Protection for Laboratories Using Chemicals

National Sentence Text: Storage cylinders and piping systems for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases used in a laboratory shall be firmly secured with a noncombustible attachment and protected against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage cylinders and piping systems for Class 2 gases used in a laboratory shall be firmly secured and protected against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Each point of supply and each point of use of cylinders or piping systems for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be provided with a label identifying the gas being supplied, and a manual shut-off valve.
P/T Sentence Text: Each point of supply and each point of use of cylinders or piping systems for Class 2 gases shall be provided with labels identifying the gas being supplied, and a manual shut-off valve.

National Sentence Text: Valves on cylinders for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be closed when not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: A Class 2 gas cylinder valve shall be closed when not in use.

National Sentence Text: Class I liquids that are stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers. (See Note A-5.5.5.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids that are stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers. (See Note A-5.5.5.5..)

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.5.(1) as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the possible accumulation of highly reactive or unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.5.(2).) (See Note A-5.5.5.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.5.(1) as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the accumulation of highly unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Where perchloric acid is heated above normal ambient temperature, it shall be done in a separate power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 5.5.4.3.and 5.5.4.4., and displaying conspicuously posted instructions specifying that the enclosure is to be used for this application only.
P/T Sentence Text: Where unstable substances, such as perchloric acid, are heated above normal ambient temperature, it shall be done in a separate power-ventilated enclosure conforming to Articles 5.5.4.3.and 5.5.4.4., and displaying conspicuously posted instructions specifying that the enclosure is to be used for this application only.

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.6.(1) as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the accumulation of highly unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.6.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.5.5.(1) as well as its exhaust duct system shall be washed after each use to prevent the accumulation of highly unstable deposits. (See Note A-5.5.5.5.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Perchloric acid shall not be heated with an open flame or in a hot oil bath.
P/T Sentence Text: Unstable substances, such as perchloric acid, shall not be heated with an open flame or in a hot oil bath.

National Sentence Text: Wastes from dangerous goods shall be identified to prevent accidental mixing of incompatible chemicals, and included in the quantities specified in Article 5.5.5.1. (See Note A-5.6.1.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Wastes from dangerous goods shall be identified to prevent accidental mixing of incompatible chemicals, and included in the quantities specified in Article 5.5.5.1. (See Note A-5.6.1.1.)

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to fire safety for buildings, parts of buildings, facilities, adjacent buildings or facilities, and associated areas undergoing construction, alteration or demolition operations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to fire safety forbuildings, parts of buildings, facilities, adjacent buildings or facilities, and associated areas undergoing construction, alteration or demolition operations.

National Sentence Text: Fuel supplies for heating equipment and internal combustion engines shall conform to CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment or CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel supplies for heating equipment and internal combustion engines shall conform to CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment or CSA CAN/CSA-B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code

National Sentence Text: Access routes for fire department vehicles shall be provided and maintained to construction and demolition sites. (See Note A-5.6.1.4.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Access routes for fire department vehicles shall be provided and maintained to construction and demolition sites.

National Sentence Text: In addition to the other requirements of this Code, portable extinguishers shall be provided in unobstructed and easily accessible locations in any areas where hot work operations are carried out, where combustibles are stored, near or on any internal combustion engines, where flammable liquids and combustible liquids or gases are stored or handled, where temporary fuel-fired equipment is used, or that are designated for smoking.
P/T Sentence Text: In addition to the other requirements of this Code, portable extinguishers shall be provided in unobstructed and easily accessible locations in areas where hot work operations are carried out, where combustibles are stored, near or on any internal combustion engines, where flammable liquidsand combustible liquids or gases are stored or handled, and where temporary fuel-fired equipment is used.

National Sentence Text: The extinguishers required by Sentence 5.6.1.5.(1) shall have a minimum rating of 3-A:20-B:C on moveable equipment (see Note A-5.6.1.5.(2)(a)), and 4-A:40-B:C in all other locations. (See Note A-5.6.1.6.)
P/T Sentence Text: The extinguishers required by Sentence 5.6.1.5.(1) shall have a minimum rating of 2-A:10-B:C on moveable equipment, and 4-A:40-B:C in all other locations. (See Note A-5.6.1.6..)

National Sentence Text: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in a building under construction or alteration, the system shall be installed progressively in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC in areas permitted to be occupied.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in a building under construction or alteration, the system shall be installed progressively in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBCin areas permitted to be occupied.

National Sentence Text: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in portions of a building under construction or alteration that are not occupied, the following shall apply: a permanent or temporary standpipe system is permitted in accordance with Clauses 5.6.1.6.(2)(b)and 5.6.1.6.(2)(c), the standpipe system shall be provided with conspicuously marked and readily accessible fire department connections on the outside of the building at street level and shall have at least one hose outlet at each floor, the pipe size, hose valves and water supply shall conform to Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC, the standpipe system shall, as a minimum, be securely supported and restrained on alternate floors, at least one hose valve for attaching fire department hose shall be provided at each intermediate landing or floor level in the exit stairway, valves shall be kept closed at all times and guarded against mechanical damage, the standpipe shall be not more than one floor below the highest forms, staging, and similar combustible elements at all times, and temporary standpipe systems shall remain in service until the permanent standpipe installation is complete.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in portions of a building under construction or alteration that are not occupied, the following shall apply: a permanent or temporary standpipe system is permitted in accordance with Clauses 5.6.1.6.(2)(b)and 5.6.1.6.(2)(c), the standpipe system shall be provided with conspicuously marked and readily accessible fire department connections on the outside of the building at street level and shall have at least one hose outlet at each floor, the pipe size, hose valves and water supply shall conform to Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC, the standpipe system shall, as a minimum, be securely supported and restrained on alternate floors, at least one hose valve for attaching fire department hose shall be provided at each intermediate landing or floor level in the exit stairway, valves shall be kept closed at all times and guarded against mechanical damage, the standpipe shall be not more than one floor below the highest forms, staging, and similar combustibles elements at all times, and temporary standpipe systems shall remain in service until the permanent standpipe installation is complete.

National Sentence Text: Roofing operations and other surface applications that involve heat sources and hot processes shall be considered hot works and shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 5.6.1.7.(2)and 5.6.1.7.(3) and Section 5.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofing operations and other surface applications that involve heat sources and hot processes shall be considered hot works and shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 5.6.1.7.(2)and 5.6.1.7.(3) andSection 5.2.

National Sentence Text: Mops that have been used for spreading bitumen shall be kept outside the building in a safe location when not in use. (See Note A-5.6.1.8.)
P/T Sentence Text: Mops that have been used for spreading bitumen shall be kept outside the building in a safe location when not in use. (See Note A-5.6.1.8..)

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 5.7.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 5.7.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1) in Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: This Part includes requirements for the inspection, testing, maintenance, and operation of portable extinguishers, water-based fire protection systems, special extinguishing systems, fire alarm systems, emergency electrical power supply systems, emergency lighting, and exit signs.
